  • 特定媒体的技术如何体现其信息？
  • How is the technology of the particular media part of its message?

在观察和撰写电影的任何形式特征或交付电影的新技术时，您的首要目标应该是实现尽可能高的精确度。开发技术术语词汇表可能非常有帮助，但最重要的是培养以最能让读者看到和听到您所描述的图像和声音的方式编写图像和声音的具体描述的能力。当然，有时比其他时候更难以实现这种详细的精确性。当你必须只处理粗略的笔记时，请尝试尽可能多地利用这些笔记。写出电影的总体风格并没有什么错（“长镜头占主导地位”，“放大的音轨”或“夸张的人造场景”），只要你的论文的重点不只是依赖于泛泛而谈。否则，请始终尝试将尽可能准确的具体描述融入到你的论点中。作为练习，描述（而不是分析）电影开头或结尾序列的所有技术特征或场景中特别有趣的声音使用。

In observing and writing about any formal features of a film or new technologies delivering films, your first goal should be to achieve as much precision as possible. Developing a vocabulary of technical terms can be extremely helpful, but most important is developing the ability to write concrete descriptions of images and sounds in the way that best allows your reader to see and hear the images and sounds you are describing. Sometimes, of course, that detailed precision is more difficult to accomplish than at other times. When you must work with only sketchy notes, try to get as much out of those notes as possible. There is nothing wrong with writing about a general style in a film (“a predominance of long shots,” “an amplified sound track,” or “exaggeratedly artificial sets”), as long as your paper has a focus that does not rely solely on generalities. Otherwise, always try to integrate as much accurate concrete description as possible into your argument. As practice, describe—without analyzing—all the technical features of an opening or closing sequence of a movie or an especially interesting use of sound in a scene.

然而，解释、分析和评估是当今大多数电影写作的主要目标。在某种程度上，你对电影中这些元素以及它们如何协同工作的欣赏必须被吸收并成为你对电影或电影含义的想法的一部分。无论您是检查序列的剪辑、一系列电影中的灯光，还是场景调度、取景和声音如何在单个场景中协同工作，请记住，观看、聆听和思考必须齐心协力。开始将你的看法转化为语言。

Interpretation, analysis, and evaluation are, however, the primary goals of most writing about film these days. Your appreciation of these elements of a film and how they work together must, at some point, be assimilated and made part of your ideas about what the film or films mean. Whether you examine the editing of a sequence, the lighting throughout a series of films, or how the mise-en-scène, framing, and sound work together in a single scene, remember that seeing, listening, and thinking must join forces as you begin to put your perceptions into words.

论文样本

SAMPLE ESSAY

 

这篇关于《搜索者》（1956）的学生论文是一个很好的例子，说明判别分析如何涉及比较问题（关于电影和文学），并在此过程中展示电影如何使用特定的技术和形式策略来表达其主题。

This student essay on The Searchers (1956) is a good example of how a discriminating analysis involves comparative questions (about film and literature) and, in the process, demonstrates how the movie uses specific technical and formal strategies to express its themes.

理查德·格施克

Richard Geschke

 

搜索者的黑暗门口

The Darkened Doorways of The Searchers

 

约翰·福特 1956 年改编的《搜索者》根据艾伦·勒梅 1954 年的小说改编，戏剧化地将故事从书本搬上银幕时可能发生的一些关键变化。大多数电影改编都需要对情节进行一些调整（通常是删除）。但在福特的《搜索者》中，我们目睹了中心人物伊森·爱德华兹的重大转变，这反过来又影响了整个故事的意义。作为福特对爱德华兹改造的一部分，影片使用了一种基于黑暗门口构图的特定图像模式，这种图像模式表明电影叙事有时可以补充甚至超越文学叙事。

Based on a 1954 novel by Alan LeMay, John Ford’s 1956 adaptation of The Searchers dramatizes some of the critical changes that can occur in moving a story from a book to the screen. Most film adaptations require some adjustments to the plot (usually deletions). But in Ford’s The Searchers, we witness a major alteration in the central character, Ethan Edwards, which in turn affects the significance of the entire story. As part of Ford’s transformation of Edwards, the film uses a specific image pattern based on the composition of a darkened doorway, an image pattern that indicates how a film narrative can sometimes supplement or even surpass a literary narrative.

 

尽管大部分中心情节元素保持不变，但改编中最显着的变化是伊森·爱德华兹的角色。小说中他是一个相当传统的西方英雄，没有太多心理复杂性，救出了侄女并回家。然而，在影片中，他的角色在三个方面变得更加复杂。首先，从一开始，就有微妙但明确的迹象表明一段神秘的、可能是犯罪的过去：自内战结束以来，伊森显然拒绝回家，并可能参与了一些不可提及的危险、暴力或非法行为。其次，福特饰演的伊森与性欲的汹涌危险作斗争。正如伊森和他兄弟的妻子玛莎的开场镜头所精心暗示的那样，伊森不得不压抑他对玛莎的爱和激情，大概知道激情会违反他所遵循的家庭准则。第三，在影片中，伊森显然是一个种族主义者。与小说中不同的是，在这里他对他的“混血”侄子（有部分美洲原住民血统）进行了讽刺，更重要的是，与小说中不同的是，他寻找黛比的任务是出于杀死她的愿望，因为他认为她受到了非白人绑架者的性侵犯。

Although most of the central plot elements remain intact, the most significant change in the adaptation is the character of Ethan Edwards. In the novel he is a fairly traditional western hero who, without much psychological complexity, rescues his niece and returns home. In the film, however, his character grows much more complicated in three ways. First, from the beginning, there is the subtle but definite indication of a mysterious and possibly criminal past: Since the end of the Civil War, Ethan apparently resisted returning home and possibly participated in some unmentionably dangerous, violent, or illegal acts. Second, Ford’s Ethan struggles with the turbulent dangers of sexual desire. As carefully suggested by the opening sequence with Ethan and his brother’s wife Martha, Ethan has had to repress his love and passion for Martha, presumably knowing that passion would violate the domestic and family codes he lives by. Third, in the film, Ethan is clearly a racist. Unlike in the novel, here he makes sarcastic remarks about his “half-breed” nephew (who is partly Native American) and, more importantly, his mission to find Debbie is, unlike in the novel, motivated by the wish to kill her because he believes she has been sexually violated by her non-white captor.

 

暴力、种族主义和性问题的伊森因此以新的方式激发了小说简单的情节并使之复杂化。一方面，《搜索者》以线性任务的方式进行：伊森和马蒂·保利寻找失踪的黛比，她被疤痕的科曼奇部落绑架了。当他们找到她并且她回到家时，这个阴谋最终以经典的方式解决了。然而，在这个线性的、向前的情节中，一个逆流是一种内在的探索，它似乎在电影中向后和向内移动，调查伊森扭曲的思想和黑暗的过去。在这些平行情节的中心，马蒂越来越意识到伊森的暴力和种族主义，并越来越多地与他对抗，最终试图阻止他杀死黛比。起初，伊森似乎没有回应任何这些自我认识的要求，他与刀疤的高潮对抗表明他没有任何改变：他不仅杀死了科曼奇酋长，而且以一种荒唐的残暴行为，福特这个电影中的伊森实际上是头皮疤痕（这在小说中没有发生）。

A violent, racist, and sexually troubled Ethan thus motivates and complicates the straightforward plot of the novel in new ways. On the one hand, The Searchers proceeds as a linear quest: Ethan and Marty Pauley search for the lost Debbie, who has been kidnapped by the Comanche tribe of Scar. That plot is ultimately resolved, in a classical manner, when they find her and she is returned home. A counter-current within this linear, forward plot, however, is an interior search that seems to move backward and inward in the film, investigating Ethan’s twisted mind and dark past. At the center of these parallel plots, Marty becomes more and more aware of Ethan’s violence and racism, and increasingly confronts him, eventually attempting to stop him from killing Debbie. At first, Ethan does not appear to respond to any of these demands for self-knowledge, and his climactic confrontation with Scar suggests that nothing about him has changed: He not only kills the Comanche chief but, in an act of grotesque brutality, Ford has this cinematic Ethan actually scalp Scar (which does not happen in the novel).

 

然而，在紧随其后的场景中，伊森追捕黛比但没有杀死她，影片表明伊森身上确实发生了一些变化，他对黛比的寻找向他自己揭示了一些关于他自己的可怕的事情。也许刀疤的倒卖行为已经成为他与自己黑暗灵魂的宣泄对抗，他越来越像是伊森的反映。也许他的整个探索在马蒂的帮助下让他看到了自己野蛮而原始的自我。他饶过黛比一命的决定，至少在一定程度上，是承认自己的暴力欲望和麻烦的过去，并将自己从自己的暴力欲望和麻烦的过去中解放出来的决定。在恢复家庭和家庭生活的需要的推动下，伊森的叙述现在变成了对从内部威胁家庭生活的黑暗激情的调查。

When in a scene that immediately follows, Ethan chases down Debbie but does not kill her, the film indicates, however, that something has indeed changed in Ethan, that his search for Debbie has revealed something horrid about himself to himself. Perhaps the scalping of Scar, who more and more seems a reflection of Ethan, has acted as a cathartic confrontation with his own dark soul. Perhaps his entire quest has, with the help of Marty, allowed him to see his own barbaric and primitive self. His decision to spare Debbie’s life becomes then, at least in part, a decision to acknowledge and free himself from his own violent desires and troubled past. Driven by the need to restore a home and domestic life, Ethan’s narrative has now become an inquiry into the dark passions that threaten that home life from within.

 

聚焦于黑暗入口的镜头模式巧妙地戏剧化了伊森两次搜索之间的紧张关系。开场时，玛莎身后四分之三的镜头显示她站在门口，眺望着平原。机舱的黑色内部与外部充满门口的明亮光线形成鲜明对比。随后，跟踪镜头跟随玛莎来到门廊上，她看着伊森在远处向她驶来。最后，当伊森将黛比送到她与乔根森一家的新家时，几乎相同的镜头再次出现。黛比和乔根森一家进入黑色内陆后，新婚的马蒂和他的妻子也随之而来。然而，伊森在门廊上犹豫了一下，然后又转身走进了沙漠。

Brilliantly dramatizing the tension between Ethan’s two searches is a pattern of shots focused on darkened entryways. At the opening, a three-quarters shot from behind Martha shows her looking across the plain as she stands in a doorway. The black interior of the cabin contrasts sharply with the bright light that fills the doorway from outside. A tracking shot then follows Martha out onto the porch where she watches Ethan riding toward her in the distance. At the conclusion, virtually the same shot recurs as Ethan delivers Debbie to her new home with the Jorgensens. After Debbie and the Jorgensens enter the black interior, the newly married Marty and his wife follow. Ethan, though, hesitates on the porch and then turns back into the desert.

 

这两个镜头都将伊森定位为一个与他所接近的家庭内部分离的流浪者。此外，使这一图像变得复杂的是，这些内部被熏黑的方式暗示着比通常与房屋内部相关的更黑暗的现实。我相信，从某种重要意义上说，外部代表了伊森必须漫步的狂野而原始的世界，而家庭（和自我）的内部则代表了伊森现在与他对玛莎的非法爱情相关的阴暗而危险的激情。

Both these shots position Ethan as a wanderer separated from the domestic interiors that he approaches. Complicating this image, moreover, those interiors are blackened in a way that suggests a darker reality than is usually associated with the inside of a home. In an important sense, I believe, the exteriors represent that wild and primitive world that Ethan must wander through, while the interiors of home (and self) represent for Ethan the shadowy and dangerous passion now associated with his illicit love of Martha.

 

在这两个黑暗门口的场景之间是第三个场景，其黑色空间是伊森故事的转折点，也是衡量这个叙述的开始和结束之间发生了什么变化的尺度。杀死刀疤后，伊森追赶逃跑的黛比到一个山洞。作为中长镜头从内部拍摄，这里的构图清楚地复制了影片开头和结尾的门口镜头。在接近畏缩的黛比后，伊森并没有像我们预期的那样杀死她，而是将她举起并说“我们回家吧，黛比。” 作为以刀疤残酷剥头皮开始的高潮转折点的一部分，这一场景成为伊森部分和暂时救赎的时刻，因为他进入了那个黑暗的内部，但悄悄地拒绝表现出他压抑的暴力。当伊森后来在类似的门槛释放黛比时，他认识到了自己的暴力激情并抵制了它。当他在门口转身走回沙漠时，长镜头承认伊森因为他的身份而无法进入那个家庭世界。用原声带的话来说，他是一个必须继续“审视自己的内心和灵魂”的人。

Between these two scenes of darkened doorways is a third scene whose black space acts as the turning point in Ethan’s story and a measure of what has changed between the beginning and end of this narrative. After killing Scar, Ethan chases the fleeing Debbie to a cave. Shot from the interior as a medium long shot, the composition here clearly replicates the doorway shots that open and close the film. After approaching the cringing Debbie, Ethan does not, as we expect, kill her but instead lifts her up and says “Let’s go home, Debbie.” As part of a climactic turning point that begins with his brutal scalping of Scar, the scene becomes a moment of partial and temporary redemption for Ethan as he enters that darkened interior but quietly refuses to act out his repressed violence. When he releases Debbie later at a similar threshold, Ethan has recognized his own violent passion and has resisted it. As he turns at the threshold and walks back into the desert, the long take becomes an acknowledgement that Ethan cannot enter that domestic world because of who he is. In the words of the sound track, he is a man who must continue to “search his heart and soul.”

 

以这种方式将小说改编成电影可能有很多社会或个人原因。显而易见的是，福特的故事版本是一个更加令人不安和不安的版本，因为它将种族和性注入到角色和叙事中。在这种情况下，将文学叙事改编为电影叙事就不再是简单地翻译人物和主题，而是创造截然不同的人物和主题。

There may be many social or personal reasons for these alterations in adapting the novel to the film in this way. What is clear is that Ford’s version of the story is a much more troubling and disturbing version as it injects race and sexuality into a character and the narrative. In this case adapting a literary narrative as a film narrative becomes not simply the translation of characters and themes but the creation of significantly different characters and themes.

 

练习

Exercises

  1. 检查改编自另一种媒介（小说、视频游戏）的材料的电影中的特定序列。在一两段中，讨论改编如何利用其特定的技术和形式资源来改变或增强原作。
  2. Examine a specific sequence from a film that adapts its material from another medium (a novel, a video game). In one or two paragraphs, argue how the adaptation has used its particular technological and formal resources to alter or enhance the original.
  3. 专注于一部影片，在与特定构图特征相关的单个元素上写两到三个段落，例如在构图镜头中使用特定角度或反复使用道具或照明技术。最后论证其对于理解电影的重要性。
  4. Focusing on one film, write two or three paragraphs on a single element associated with a specific compositional feature—such as the use of a certain angle in composing shots or a recurrent use of a prop or lighting technique. Conclude by arguing its importance to an understanding of the film.

4

电影写作的六种方法

4

SIX APPROACHES TO WRITING ABOUT FILM

 

两位作家可能都对弗里茨·朗的《猩红街》 （1945）中的灯光感兴趣，但他们可能会使用不同的方法来集中讨论。使用形式主义方法的作家可能会分析电影中图像的重复或光影的变化；使用历史方法的作家可能会展示这些灯光图案如何与朗在德国表现主义时期的开端联系起来。同样，当作家讨论雷诺阿电影中的风格相似性或音乐剧中的历史变化时，也会使用不同的方法。在第一种情况下，作者含蓄地使用了“作者”方法，这种方法基于这样的信念：电影可以通过导演的风格联系起来；在第二个例子中，作者进行了类型批评，其中假定了某些已被接受的电影类型。对这些方法的认识意味着你的写作比许多有能力的电影作家拥有（甚至希望拥有）更具理论性。然而，即使当您分析一部电影时，了解您所使用的方法也很重要且有用，因为这种意识将帮助您确定方法的局限性、观众的需求以及论文的目标。

Two writers may both be interested in the lighting in Fritz Lang’s Scarlet Street (1945), but they may use different methods to focus that discussion. A writer using a formalist approach might analyze the repetitions of an image or the variations of light and shadow within the film; a writer using a historical approach might show how those lighting patterns can be linked to Lang’s beginnings in the German expressionist period. Likewise, different approaches are used when writers discuss stylistic similarities in the films of Renoir or historical changes in the musical. In the first case, the writer uses, implicitly, an “auteur” approach, which is based on the belief that films can be linked through the style of the director; in the second, the writer practices genre criticism, which presumes certain accepted types of movies. An awareness of these methods implies a more theoretical aim in your writing than many competent writers about film have (or even wish to have). Yet even when you analyze a single film, it is important and useful to understand the approach you are using, because this awareness will help you to identify the limits of the approach, the needs of your audience, and the goals of the essay.

当您考虑一篇论文的主题（例如编辑技术）并开始确定该主题时，还要考虑您的方法背后的假设：您是否对某种特定技术（例如并行编辑）感兴趣，因为一位导演经常使用它吗？您是否有兴趣研究一系列图像，因为它们将电影与社会学和文化问题联系起来，就像 Lotte Eisner 所做的那样，她认为 1920 年代德国电影中的许多楼梯与魏玛德国社会的浪漫野心有关？您是否想重点关注爱森斯坦蒙太奇等技术的使用如何挑战传统的剪辑方式，从而暗示电影形式的重要变化？无论您认为哪种方法合适，如果您了解更大的问题，您总是会澄清您的目标和限制。例如，在比较两部电影或电影的一部分时，决定比较的术语（形式、历史或其他）可能是组织比较的重要一步。

As you consider a topic for an essay—such as an editing technique—and as you begin to give that topic shape, consider also the assumptions that underlie your approach: Are you interested in a particular technique, such as parallel editing, because one director uses it regularly? Are you interested in examining a series of images because they relate the film to sociological and cultural issues, as Lotte Eisner does when she suggests that the many staircases in German films of the 1920s relate to the romantic ambitions of the society of Weimar Germany? Do you want to focus on how the use of a technique, such as Eisenstein’s montage, challenged the way editing had traditionally been used and thus suggests an important change in film form? No matter what approach you find appropriate, you will always clarify your aims and limits if you get a sense of the larger issues. When comparing two films or parts of films, for example, deciding on the terms of that comparison—formal, historical, or other—can be an important step in organizing that comparison.

以下对电影写作中使用的主要方法或方法的介绍并不试图回顾任何单一方法的复杂性或在一项研究中两种或多种方法可能重叠的方式。然而，这些草图和示例应该可以帮助您确定可以指导您撰写电影文章的方法，并让您了解特定方法如何组织和使用信息。

The following introduction to the major approaches or methods used in writing about film does not attempt to review the complexities of any single approach or the ways two or more approaches may overlap in one study. These sketches and examples should, however, help you to identify approaches that can direct your writing about film and give you a sense of how a particular method might organize and use information.

电影史

FILM HISTORY

 

历史方法是电影批评中最广泛使用的方法之一。它可以以不同程度的重点或意识来使用，但总的来说，使用这种方法的作者根据电影在历史背景中的位置并根据历史发展来组织和研究电影。这种方法可能会探索以下内容：

A historical approach is one of the most widely used methods in film criticism. It can be employed with varying degrees of emphasis or consciousness, but in general, the writer using this approach organizes and investigates films according to their place within a historical context and in light of historical developments. Such an approach might explore the following:

  • 电影本身的历史关系，就像作家将 20 世纪 30 年代的电影中布景的使用与 1970 年代的电影中布景的使用进行比较和对比一样。
  • The historical relationships of the films themselves, as when a writer compares and contrasts the use of sets in a film from the 1930s with their use in a film from the 1970s.
  • 电影与其制作条件的关系，也许可以让作家将 20 世纪 80 年代的美国电影与那些年的海湾+西方公司或泛美公司等大公司拥有制片厂的趋势联系起来，或者调查广泛的当今数字技术的影响已经改变了电影的制作和观看方式。
  • The relationship of films to their conditions of production, perhaps allowing a writer to make connections between American films of the 1980s and the trend during those years toward the ownership of studios by large corporations like Gulf+Western or TransAmerica, or to investigate how the wide impact of digital technology today has altered how movies are made and watched.
  • 一篇文章探讨了 20 世纪 50 年代的电视如何改变了当时电影观众的期望，展示了电影与其接受程度的关系。
  • The relationship of movies to their reception, demonstrated in an essay that explores how television in the 1950s changed the expectations of movie audiences at that time.

尽管有多种方法可以在不强调历史问题的情况下撰写电影文章，但大多数电影写作都具有一定的历史意识。一篇在二战后的美国背景下审视米尔德里德·皮尔斯（Mildred Pierce ，1945）以及女性社会学地位变化的文章将基于历史方法，尽管论证的方向和观点可能是女权主义批判。同样，一篇对《狂野的一群》 （1969）的主题和风格进行直接解读的文章可以通过将这些主题与越南战争、美国西部片的历史或1969年电影技术的创新联系起来来发展这种解读。 20 世纪 60 年代。许多激动人心且内容丰富的历史文章的主要主题与具体电影的分析几乎没有关系，相反，几乎完全集中在历史事实和复杂性上，例如经济危机，或者审查制度背后的政治压力——这只能间接影响观众在屏幕上看到的内容。

Although there are ways to write about film without emphasizing historical issues, some historical awareness informs most writing about film. An essay that examines Mildred Pierce (1945) in the context of post–World War II America and the changing sociological position of women would be based on a historical method, even though the direction and point of the argument may be a feminist critique. Similarly, an essay that presents a straightforward reading of the themes and style of The Wild Bunch (1969) could develop that reading by relating those subjects to the Vietnam War, the history of the western in American movies, or innovations in movie technology during the 1960s. Many exciting and informative historical essays have main topics that have little or nothing to do with the analysis of specific films and, instead, concentrate almost exclusively on historical facts and complexities—an economic crisis, say, or the political pressures behind an instance of censorship—that only indirectly figure in what an audience sees on the screen.

当使用历史方法来帮助解释电影时，请注意不要假设任何特定的电影，甚至是纪录片，都直接描绘了一个社会和一个历史时期。诚然，《每日面包》（1934）向我们讲述了很多关于 1930 年代初美国大萧条时期的信息，但它所讲述的内容与历史问题密切相关，例如其风格和目标受众。历史是一件精密的仪器；尽可能有区别地使用它。在《电影史：理论与实践》中，罗伯特·艾伦和道格拉斯·戈马利指出，“研究历史需要判断，而不仅仅是事实的传递”(iv)。在阅读 FW Murnau 的《日出》 （1927）的摘录中，他们展示了如何利用历史研究来激发人们对电影的奢华和艺术技巧的最初好奇心：

When using a historical method to help explain a film, beware of assuming that any particular movie, even a documentary, gives an unmediated picture of a society and a historical period. To be sure, Our Daily Bread (1934) tells us a great deal about the early 1930s in America during the Great Depression, but what it tells us is bound up with historical questions concerning, for example, its style and intended audience. History is a delicate instrument; use it with as much discrimination as possible. In Film History: Theory and Practice, Robert Allen and Douglas Gomery note that “doing history requires judgment, not merely the transmission of facts” (iv). In this excerpt from their reading of F. W. Murnau’s Sunrise (1927), they demonstrate how historical research can be used to fuel an initial curiosity about the lavish and artsy techniques of the movie:

威廉·福克斯 (William Fox) 决定聘请 FW 穆尔瑙 (FW Murnau) 并让他几乎全权委托他制作《日出》，这不仅仅是在 1927 年至 1928 年的福克斯计划中再增加一部“高度艺术化的影片”。福克斯利用穆尔瑙的传记传奇作为精心策划的计划的一部分，以将他的工作室的地位提升到电影行业的卓越地位。20世纪20年代中期，福克斯与第一国家电影公司和华纳兄弟公司一起，无论是在经济实力还是产品声誉方面都占据了电影业的中间梯队。（声望可以定义为该工作室的电影在当时的批评话语中被认为具有“质量”的程度。）在 20 年代中期，福克斯以朴实无华、“民间”影片的制片人而闻名。不受评论家高度评价，但大部分受到大众观众的欢迎。例如，检查 1925 年《电影日报年鉴》和《Photoplay》的“最佳电影”列表，我们发现，在 184 位不同影评人引用的 184 部“最佳”影片中，只有 9 部是福克斯电影；在这两个列表中，派拉蒙和米高梅的电影占据主导地位。

William Fox’s decision to hire F. W. Murnau and to give him virtually carte blanche in the production of Sunrise involved much more than the addition of one more “highly artistic picture” to the 1927–1928 Fox schedule. Fox used Murnau’s considerable biographical legend as part of a carefully orchestrated plan to elevate the status of his studio to that of preeminence in the motion picture industry. In the mid-1920s, Fox occupied, along with First National and Warner Bros., a middle echelon within the film industry both in terms of economic power and product prestige. (Prestige can be defined as the extent to which the films of a studio are perceived to be of “quality” in the critical discourse of the period.) In the mid-1920s Fox was known as a producer of unpretentious, “folksy” pictures, not highly regarded by critics but for the most part popular with the mass audience. Examining the “Best Films” lists of Film Daily Yearbook and Photoplay for 1925, for example, we find that of 184 “best” pictures cited by 184 different critics, only 9 were Fox titles; in both lists the films of Paramount and MGM predominate.

 

然而，1925 年，威廉·福克斯启动了电影业历史上最伟大的扩张计划之一。该计划最终随着 1929 年股市崩盘而崩溃，但就在他倒台之前，福克斯控制了福克斯和米高梅制片厂、洛斯剧院、福克斯自己的大型连锁剧院的制作，以及英国高蒙第一国家剧院的三分之一权益，以及其他各种资产。1920 年代末，福克斯在追求经济实力的同时，也试图提高福克斯制作的声望，正是在这种背景下，穆瑙的聘用和他制作的《日出》必须被审视。福克斯预计穆尔瑙将制作出极具艺术性的作品这张照片将增强他工作室的“特殊”电影类别。除非特别节目能够吸引更多评论界的关注，否则福克斯的声望将永远无法与他所希望的经济地位相匹配。(99)

In 1925, however, William Fox launched one of the greatest expansion plans in the history of the motion picture industry. The plan eventually collapsed with the stock market crash of 1929, but just before his downfall Fox controlled the production of Fox and MGM studios, Loews Theatres, Fox’s own large theater chain, and a one-third interest in First National Theatres, British Gaumont, and assorted other holdings. The Fox drive for economic power in the late 1920s was paralleled by attempts to enhance the prestige of Fox productions, and it is in this context that Murnau’s hiring and his production of Sunrise must be viewed. Fox anticipated that Murnau’s production of the highly artistic picture would bolster his studio’s “special” films category. Unless the specials could attract greater critical attention, Fox would never have the prestige to match his hoped-for economic status. (99)

 

如果您决定采用历史方法，请问自己关于历史在您的论证中的作用的具体问题：您在研究中使用的历史信息是背景信息还是介绍性信息？您是否关心电影中如何以及为何呈现某些历史事件？历史背景是否有助于解释影片中的叙事或技术动作？这部电影是在历史上脱颖而出，还是历史趋势的一部分？你的论点是为了澄清历史上的那个地方吗？对你的论点来说，哪一个更重要：电影制作背后的历史事实，历代观众对此有何反应，或者两者兼而有之？无论你的具体主题是什么，问问自己历史可能在其中扮演什么角色。

If you decide that yours will be a historical approach, ask yourself specific questions about the role history will have in your argument: Is the historical information you use background or introductory information for your study? Are you concerned with how and why certain historical events are represented as they are in the movie? Does historical background help to explain narrative or technical maneuvers in the film? Does the movie stand out in history, or is it part of a historical trend? Is your argument intended to clarify that place in history? What is more important to your argument: the historical facts behind the film’s production, how its successive audiences responded to it, or both? No matter what your specific subject, ask yourself what part history might play in it.

国家电影院

NATIONAL CINEMAS

 

如果历史问题通常在电影文章中发挥一定作用，那么讨论它们的另一个重要（且相关）的方式是根据它们的文化或民族特征。这种方法背后的假设是，电影文化随着一定程度的个性而发展，要理解亚历山大·多夫任科的《兵工厂》（ 1928）的复杂性，我们必须首先将其置于革命后俄罗斯的政治和审美氛围中。同样，要分析萨蒂亚吉特·雷的印度电影，例如《遥远的雷霆》（1973），作家应该对印度的社会和文化有所了解。根据这种方法，电影中看待世界的方式和描绘世界的方式因国家和文化而异，如果我们要了解电影的内容，就必须了解电影周围的文化条件。由于它采用了许多西方主题和公式，美国观众可能会毫无困难地理解黑泽明的电影，但如果没有日本社会的指导和一些文化背景，沟口健二或成濑干夫的电影可能会显得过于陌生和令人困惑。普通美国学生。

If historical issues usually play some part in essays on the movies, another important (and related) way to discuss them is in terms of their cultural or national character. The presumption behind this approach is that film cultures evolve with a certain amount of individuality and that to understand, for instance, the complexities of Alexander Dovzhenko’s Arsenal (1928), one must locate it first in the political and aesthetic climate of postrevolutionary Russia. Similarly, to analyze an Indian film of Satyajit Ray, such as Distant Thunder (1973), a writer should know something about the society and culture of India. According to this approach, ways of seeing the world and ways of portraying the world in the movies differ for each country and culture, and it is necessary to understand the cultural conditions that surround a movie if we are to understand what it is about. Because it employs many Western themes and formulas, an American spectator might have little trouble comprehending a film by Akira Kurosawa, but without guidance and some cultural background on Japanese society, the films of Kenji Mizoguchi or Mikio Naruse might seem too foreign and confusing for the average American student.

观察下段作者如何识别Ousmane Sembene 和Med Hondo 的非洲电影的具体文化遗产（图4.01）。在承认其他国家电影（如让-吕克·戈达尔的法国新浪潮）的影响的同时，他指出了一种口头传统，该传统将一系列不同的电影区分和标记为独特的非洲电影：

Observe how the author of the following passage identifies the specific cultural heritage of the African films of Ousmane Sembene and Med Hondo (Figure 4.01). While admitting the influences of other national cinemas (like the French New Wave of Jean-Luc Godard), he singles out an oral tradition that distinguishes and marks a range of different films as uniquely African:

图 4.01 Sembene 的Xala（1974）具体反映了非洲的遗产和问题（例如，更关注集体而不是个人行动）。因此，撰写这部电影总是受益于对其国家和文化背景的熟悉。

Figure 4.01 Sembene’s Xala (1974) reflects specifically African heritages and issues (concentrating, for instance, on communal more than on individual actions). Writing about this film thus always benefits from some familiarity with its national and cultural context.

 

尽管非洲电影制片人将口头传统作为主要影响力，但他们以各种方式挪用并应用它，以创造解决非洲广泛的社会、政治、文化和历史问题的范式……尽管他们的风格截然相反彼此之间，这种口头传统和非洲电影语言的使用可以在电影 Ousmane Sembene 和 Med Hondo 中找到。虽然 Sembene 的叙事比 Hondo 的更加线性，并且充满了直接的说教主义（如Borrom Sarret、Mandabi、《The Money Order》，1968 年、Xala， 1974 年和Camp de Thiaroye， 1987 年），但 Hondo 的电影（Soleil O， 1969 年和《西印度群岛》， 1979）的语气是……切分音和爆发性的，让人想起法国黑人解放主义文学在风格上具有破坏性的语气。这两位电影制作人不仅受到许多西方影响（如意大利新现实主义、好莱坞、拉丁美洲纪录片和苏联蒙太奇），而且也受益于本土的口头讲故事技巧。因此，虽然西方评论家倾向于将洪多的风格解读为前卫和戈达尔风格，但非洲主义话语却强调其与口头传统的联系。（乌卡迪克 571）

Although African filmmakers invoke oral tradition as a primary influence, they have appropriated it and applied it in various ways to create paradigms for addressing the broad range of social, political, cultural and historical issues of Africa.... Although their styles are diametrically opposed to each other, this use of oral tradition and African film language can be identified in the films Ousmane Sembene and Med Hondo. While Sembene’s narrative is more linear than Hondo’s and imbued with straightforward didacticism (as in Borrom Sarret, Mandabi, “The Money Order,” 1968, Xala, 1974, and Camp de Thiaroye, 1987), Hondo’s films (Soleil O, 1969, and West Indies, 1979) are...syncopated and eruptive in tone, and reminiscent of the stylistically disruptive tone of black French liberationist literature. The two filmmakers not only share a number of Western influences (such as Italian Neo-Realism, Hollywood, Latin American documentary, and Soviet montage) but are indebted to indigenous oral storytelling techniques as well. Thus, while Western critics have tended to read Hondo’s style as avant-garde and Godardian, Africanist discourse has emphasized its link with oral tradition. (Ukadike 571)

 

当决定讨论来自外国文化的一部电影或一组电影时，作家可能会首先以开放的心态质疑这些电影与他或他所看的美国电影到底有什么区别。她很熟悉。（这意味着，同时，作者将勾画出特定时期美国电影的具体特征。）当这些电影在其文化之外观看时，它们的含义会发生怎样的变化？作为一个美国人，您对 20 世纪 50 年代英国电影的理解可能与当时的英国观众有何不同？什么样的文化研究可以让你更好地把握这些主题？你应该读一些关于电影业其他艺术、政治、经济的文章吗？尽量不要过度简化文化与其电影之间的联系；请记住，这种方法意味着（也许是错误的）一个国家的许多不同电影之间存在统一性或基本相似性。你能在 20 世纪 90 年代的美国电影中找到类似的统一吗？

When deciding to discuss a movie or a group of movies from a foreign culture, a writer might begin by questioning, with an open mind, what exactly distinguishes these films from the American ones with which he or she is familiar. (This implies that, at the same time, the writer will sketch a sense of what is specific about the American cinema of a given period.) How do the meanings of these films change when they are seen outside their culture? In what ways might you, as an American, understand British films of the 1950s differently from the English audience at that time? What kind of cultural research might give you a better handle on the themes? Should you read something about the other arts, the politics, the economics of the movie industry there? Try not to oversimplify the connections between a culture and its films; remember that an approach of this kind implies (perhaps falsely) a unity or a fundamental similarity between many different films from a country. Could you find a similar kind of unity in American movies of the 1990s?

流派

GENRES

 

流派是一个法语单词，意思是“种类”，是根据形式和内容的常见模式对电影进行分类的类别。我们中的许多人在观看电影时，会随意练习类型研究背后的分类：通常，我们会识别出一组相似的主题、人物、叙事结构和摄影技术，将电影联系在一起，如西部片、音乐剧、黑色电影、公路电影、情节剧、或科幻电影。西部片以牛仔和开放、不文明的空间为特色；科幻电影讲述外太空的冒险或外星人的入侵。在分析性写作中，对类型的讨论通常是开始检查电影如何组织故事和观众期望的有效方法。像约翰·福特的《射杀自由的人》（ The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance，1962）这样的西部片显然是出于一种通用的传统，尽管谈论这部电影的方式可能有很多种，但最重要的方式之一就是审视它对许多传统观念的颠覆。传统模式和对西方的期望。这部特别的电影讲述了一位西方英雄的故事，但我们发现这位英雄与通常的西方英雄不同，并且对故意的通用变异感到惊讶。

A French word meaning “kind,” genre is a category for classifying films in terms of common patterns of form and content. Many of us casually practice the categorizing behind genre studies when we view movies: Often, we identify a set of similar themes, characters, narrative structures, and camera techniques that link movies together as westerns, musicals, film noir, road movies, melodramas, or sci-fi films. Westerns feature cowboys and open, uncivilized spaces; sci-fi movies deal with adventures in outer space or intrusions by extraterrestrials. In analytical writing, a discussion of genre is frequently an effective way to begin examining how a film organizes its story and its audience’s expectations. A western such as John Ford’s The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962) operates expressly out of a generic tradition, and although there may be many ways of talking about the film, one of the most important is to examine its subversion of many of the traditional patterns and expectations about the western. This particular movie is the tale of a western hero, but we discover that this hero is not like the usual western hero and are surprised by the intentional generic variation.

在下面的段落中，维维安·索布查克讨论了黑色电影的类型。她没有专注于这一类型的众所周知的特征（例如犯罪故事和黑暗灯光的使用），而是在这里强调了这种战后类型中房屋和家庭之间更微妙的对比：

In the following passage, Vivian Sobchack discusses the genre of film noir. Rather than concentrate on well-known characteristics of this genre (such as stories of crime and the use of dark lighting), she highlights here the more subtle contrast between a house and home in this postwar genre:

在黑色电影中，房子几乎从来都不是家。事实上，失去家园成为黑色电影中结构性的缺席。尤其值得一提的是，《双重赔偿》（1944年）或《米尔德里德·皮尔斯》（1945年）中贯穿的讽刺性“家庭性”——这些电影与黑色电影有着不可挽回的联系，但却对其特定的城市形象提出了问题。郊区菲利斯·迪特里希森邀请保险代理人沃尔特·内夫进入的房子只是一座房子：家具朴素，装饰稀疏且缺乏个性，就像汽车旅馆一样。它看起来不像有人居住。事实上，它的内部装饰可以用后来的黑色电影《大热》（The Big Heat ，1953）中一个角色关于房子的对话来描述：“嘿，我喜欢这个。早什么都没有。” 而且，即使在她的家庭生活开始时，米尔德里德的家也只是一座房子：单调、朴素、没有住在那里的人的标记，据说构成了一个家庭。米尔德里德烤馅饼的厨房没有诺曼·洛克威尔厨房的温暖和舒适，也不是一个适宜的空间。这种缺乏幸福感在她的画外音旁白中得到了呼应，并伴随着闪回：“我总是在厨房里。我感觉自己好像出生在厨房里，除了结婚的那几个小时之外，我一生都住在那里。” (144)

In [film] noir, a house is almost never a home. Indeed, the loss of home becomes a structuring absence in film noir. It is particularly telling to think here of the ironic “domesticity” that runs through Double Indemnity (1944) or Mildred Pierce (1945)—films that are linked irrevocably to noir but pose problems to its particular urban iconography. The suburban house into which Phyllis Dietrichson invites insurance agent Walter Neff is merely a house: its furniture plain, its decorations sparse and impersonal, motel-like. It doesn’t look lived in. Indeed, its interior decoration is best described in a line of dialogue offered by a character about a house in a later film noir, The Big Heat (1953): “Hey, I like this. Early nothing.” And, even in her domestic beginnings, Mildred’s home is also figured as merely a house: drab, plain, unmarked by the people who live there and supposedly constitute a family. The kitchen in which Mildred bakes her pies has none of the warmth and coziness of Norman Rockwell’s kitchens and is hardly a felicitous space. And this lack of felicity is echoed in her voice-over narration that accompanies a flashback: “I was always in the kitchen. I felt as though I’d been born in a kitchen and lived there all my life except for the few hours it took to get married.” (144)

 

在撰写电影类型时，无论是浪漫喜剧还是恐怖电影，请始终牢记历史区别，就像索布哈克在这里所做的那样，因为类型会随着时间而变化。还要自己确定与特定流派相关的常见结构、主题和风格技巧。这种类型的电影什么时候首次出现？电影史之外的前因是什么——小说、歌剧？历史上它是如何变化的，为什么？您正在分析的电影的故事是否符合它所处的类型？如果不是，那么通用公式的混合和匹配是否有其目的，就像《银翼杀手》（1982）中侦探和科幻类型等叠加的那样？随着这些年流派的成熟，你可能会在电影对通用公式的使用中发现一种奇怪的自我意识，就像《射杀自由的人》中的那样。这种自我意识是如何运用的呢？这是试图取笑这一类型，还是试图展示该类型在描述现代世界的复杂性方面的局限性？《阳光小美女》 （2006）是一部讲述一个不正常家庭参加年轻女孩选美比赛的电影，是否可以被视为公路电影的疯狂变体？《断背山》（2005）讲述了两个牛仔之间秘密性关系的故事；它的力量和复杂性在多大程度上取决于电影如何有意识地融入西部片传统及其男性刻板印象？

In writing about a film genre, whether it’s a romantic comedy or a horror film, always keep historical distinctions in mind, as Sobchack does here, because genres change with the times. Also identify for yourself what common structures, themes, and stylistic techniques are associated with a particular genre. When did this type of movie first appear? What are the antecedents outside film history—novels, opera? How has it changed through history, and why? Does the story of the movie you are analyzing fit the genre it seems to be placed in? If not, does the mixing and matching of generic formulas serve a purpose, as in Blade Runner (1982), in which the detective and sci-fi genres, among others, are superimposed? As genres mature through the years, you may discover a strange self-consciousness in a film’s use of generic formulas, as in The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance. How is this self-consciousness used? Is it an attempt to poke fun at the genre, or is it an attempt to show the limits of the genre in describing the complexities of the modern world? Could Little Miss Sunshine (2006), a film about a dysfunctional family’s journey to a beauty contest for young girls, be discussed as a madcap variation on the road movie? Brokeback Mountain (2005) is the story of secret sexual relationship between two cowboys; to what extent is its power and complexity a function of how the film consciously engages the tradition of the western and its masculine stereotypes?

作者

AUTEURS

 

作者批评是当今最广泛接受且经常无意识地实践的电影批评之一：它通过将电影与导演或偶尔与另一位主导者联系起来来识别和审查一部电影。人物，例如明星（例如克林特·伊斯特伍德）。从某种意义上说，提及“大卫·里恩的电影”或“史蒂文·斯皮尔伯格的电影”本身就是一种批评行为，因为它意味着你在银幕上看到的统一愿景是导演的，并且存在某些共同的主题以及将同一位电影制片人的电影联系起来的风格特征。尽管作家们不经意地将一位主要演员甚至编剧称为作者（“作者”），但作者批评有其历史根源，即某些导演所提出的或为某些导演所提出的文学独立性和创造力的主张。自 20 世纪 50 年代以来，它已成为撰写电影的标准策略，导演被理解为锚定和统一我们对电影的看法的作者。在这里，托马斯·艾尔塞瑟审视了塞缪尔·富勒电影中的人物，并指出了富勒的指导愿景和一贯兴趣所导致的一般人物特征和行为：

Auteur criticism is one of the most widely accepted and often unconsciously practiced film criticisms today: It identifies and examines a movie by associating it with a director or occasionally with another dominant figure, such as a star (say, Clint Eastwood). In a sense, referring to “a David Lean film” or “a Steven Spielberg movie” is in itself a critical act, because it implies that the unifying vision behind what you see on the screen is the director’s and that there are certain common themes and stylistic traits that link films by the same filmmaker. Although writers refer casually to a dominant actor or even a screenwriter as an auteur (an “author”), auteur criticism has its historical roots in the claims of literary independence and creativity made by and for certain directors. Since the 1950s, it has become a standard strategy in writing about film, with the director understood to be the auteur who anchors and unifies our perception of the film. Here, Thomas Elsaesser examines characters in the films of Samuel Fuller and pinpoints general character traits and actions attributable to Fuller’s guiding vision and consistent interests:

许多富勒英雄最显着的特征之一是他们愿意——实际上是强迫——将自己暴露在充满矛盾的情境中。可以说，富勒的英雄只有在身体或精神承受极大压力的情况下才会出现。他们似乎而且经常处于歇斯底里的边缘，他们的行动方式暴露出一种强烈的、高度爆炸性的能量。

One of the most distinctive features of a great number of Fuller heroes is their willingness—indeed their compulsion—to expose themselves to situations charged with contradiction. The Fuller heroes, as it were, come to life only under conditions of extreme physical or mental stress; they seem, and often are, on the verge of hysteria, and their mode of action betrays a kind of electric, highly explosive energy.

 

矛盾的是，人们得到的印象是，这种明显的精神和情绪不稳定使他们意志和行动坚强。我想到的人物有《亚利桑那男爵》、《钢盔》中的扎克、《箭奔》中的奥米拉、 《美国黑社会》中的托利·德夫林，甚至《美林掠夺者》中的梅里尔。所有人都生活在不可能的情况下，知道自己无法获胜，但他们仍然以一种信念、一种本能的直接性来行动——就好像他们在不断地向前飞行，并致力于采取一种行动方针，而他们的反常行为正是在这种行动方针中发生的。几乎看起来很高兴，因为他们直觉地接受它作为他们存在的基本条件。(291)

Paradoxically, the impression one gets is that this apparent mental and emotional instability is what makes them strong in will and action. I am thinking of figures like the Baron of Arizona, Zack in The Steel Helmet, O’Meara in Run of the Arrow, Tolly Devlin in Underworld USA, and even Merrill in Merrill’s Marauders. All live impossible situations, and knowing they cannot win, they nevertheless act with a kind of conviction, a kind of instinctive immediacy—as if they were engaged in an incessant flight forward, and were committing themselves to a course of action in whose perverseness they almost seem to rejoice, because they intuitively accept it as the fundamental condition of their existence. (291)

 

尽管作者论为许多优秀的研究提供了基础，但出于至少两个原因，在使用它时应该持一定的怀疑态度。导演很少能拥有该术语所暗示的完全控制权，因为从编剧到剪辑师的任何人都可能对电影的外观和逻辑负有更大的责任。根据时间和地点的不同，作者所代表的内容也有很大不同。20世纪60年代法国导演特吕弗或埃里克·侯麦所使用的“作者”一词与今天韦斯·安德森或大卫·林奇所使用的“作者”一词有着截然不同的含义。如果您对同一导演的两部电影的剪辑进行比较研究，您应该明确表示您知道您正在使用作者模型，并指出该标签如何适用于该导演。还要询问电影制作的历史条件如何鼓励或阻碍你在他或她的作品中发现作者论的统一。这些电影是否像乔治·库克的电影一样，是作为制片厂系统的一部分制作的，其中制片厂的影响可能比导演的影响更明显？或者电影制片人是否像英国电影制片人彼得·格林纳威一样拥有很大的独立性，从而可以控制电影的外观？电影制片人对电影的掌控力最显着的标志是什么：剪辑？故事本身？主题？那个设定？你对一部电影的期望是否取决于你对导演的了解，就像你预计萨姆·佩金法的电影中会出现大量暴力一样？为什么？这些年来导演的工作有哪些变化，您如何解释这些变化？这位电影制作人在每部电影中是否都有特殊的标志，比如阿尔弗雷德·希区柯克的客串、约瑟夫·冯·斯滕伯格为玛琳·黛德丽拍摄的电影肖像，或者斯派克·李在他的一些电影中作为演员的出现？最后请记住，复杂的作者研究感兴趣的是电影，而不是电影制片人的心理或私人生活。

Although auteurism provides the foundation for many excellent studies, it should be used with some skepticism for at least two reasons. Rarely does a director have the total control that the term suggests, because anyone from a scriptwriter to an editor may be more responsible for the look and logic of a film. And what an auteur represents differs quite a bit depending on the time and place; auteur applied to French directors Truffaut or Eric Rohmer in the 1960s has quite a different meaning from auteur applied to Wes Anderson or David Lynch today. If you embark on a comparative study of the editing in two films by the same director, you should make it clear that you know you are using an auteur model and indicate how that tag applies to this director. Ask also how the historical conditions of film production encourage or discourage the auteurist unity you find in his or her work. Were the films made as part of a studio system, as were George Cukor’s, in which the influence of the studio might be more noticeable than the influence of the director? Or did the filmmaker have a great deal of independence, as does the British filmmaker Peter Greenaway, and thus control over how the film looks? What are the most distinctive signs of the filmmaker’s control over the film: Editing? The stories themselves? The themes? The setting? Are your expectations about a film conditioned by what you know about its director, as when you anticipate a great deal of violence from a Sam Peckinpah movie? Why? What kind of changes are there in the director’s work over the years, and how do you account for them? Are there special marks of this filmmaker in each of the films, like Alfred Hitchcock’s cameos, Josef von Sternberg’s cinematic portraits of Marlene Dietrich, or Spike Lee’s appearance as an actor in some of his movies? Keep in mind, finally, that sophisticated auteur studies are interested in the films, not in the psychology or private life of the filmmaker.

形式主义的种类

KINDS OF FORMALISM

 

形式主义是电影批评的一个名称，通常涉及电影的结构和风格问题，或者涉及第三章中讨论的那些特征（例如叙事或场景）如何在电影中以特定方式组织。在大多数情况下，作家希望将这些形式问题与电影的主要主题一起讨论，但形式主义文章的主要焦点将放在诸如叙事开头和结尾、摄影技术的显着重复和变化等模式上，或者镜头和序列之间的关系。在讨论宽银幕电影的背景下，通过专注于色彩和空间，以下摘录的作者用形式主义术语对序列进行了富有启发性和准确的描述：

Formalism is a name often given to film criticism concerned with matters of structure and style in a movie, or with how those features discussed in Chapter 3 (such as the narrative or the mise-en-scène) are organized in particular ways in a movie. In most instances, a writer will want to discuss these formal matters together with the major themes of a film, but the chief focus of a formalist essay will be on patterns such as narrative openings and closings, the significant repetition and variation of camera techniques, or the relation of shots and sequences to each other. In the context of a discussion of CinemaScope and by concentrating on color and space, the writer of the following excerpt presents an illuminating and exact account of a sequence in formalistic terms:

在《无因的反叛》（雷，1955）中，影片前二十分钟后出现了一个异常美丽的镜头，在此期间，周围的环境都一致狭窄和压抑，图像物理上杂乱无章，以黑人和棕色人种为主。现在，詹姆斯·迪恩即将启程上学；他看着窗外。他认出了远处走过的一个女孩（娜塔莉·伍德饰）。切换到第一天/外景镜头，第一个明亮的镜头，第一个“水平”的镜头。娜塔莉·伍德 (Natalie Wood) 的特写镜头，身穿浅绿色羊毛衫，背景是绿色灌木丛。当她行走时，摄像机会随着她横向移动。这给人一种直接的感性印象，让我们有洞察力融入迪恩的经验，同时保持完全自然和非强迫性。在小屏幕上，这样的图像不可能具有可比的重量。（巴尔 10-11）

In Rebel Without a Cause (Ray, 1955) a shot of extraordinary beauty comes after the first twenty minutes of the film, during which the surroundings have been uniformly cramped and depressing, the images physically cluttered-up and dominated by blacks and browns. Now, James Dean is about to set out for school; he looks out of the window. He recognizes a girl (Natalie Wood) walking past in the distance. Cut to the first day/exterior shot, the first bright one, the first “horizontal” one. A close shot of Natalie Wood, in a light-green cardigan, against a background of green bushes. As she walks the camera moves laterally with her. This makes a direct sensual impression which gives us an insight into Dean’s experience, while at the same time remaining completely natural and unforced. On the small screen, such an image could not conceivably have had a comparable weight. (Barr 10–11)

 

严格来说，形式主义批评并不强调电影本身之外的问题，例如电影对观众可能产生的不同影响、其制作的历史条件或任何其他在银幕上无法立即显现的问题。（然而，今天你很少能找到一篇纯粹形式主义的文章；通常形式主义分析会成为有关作者、电影史、流派等其他争论的一部分。）因此，纯粹形式主义分析可能会调查叙事的统一性《他的女孩星期五》（1940）中，两个主角通过一系列对抗和危机推动情节发展，这些对抗和危机始于离婚，终于结婚。编剧可能会在电影的剪辑或灯光中仔细寻找风格或形式上的重复，然后描述它们与电影其余部分的关系。另一种选择是选择一个视觉上复杂的场景或序列，并描述它的工作原理以及为什么它对电影很重要。例如，在《肖恩》（1953）的早期，肖恩、农民、妻子和孩子之间有一次快速而复杂的眼神交流，这种交流为电影的其余部分建立了社会关系；正式的分析可以解释相机如何如此快速地进行通信。无论您是在检查单个镜头还是一组图像，请问问自己，形式特征中最有趣和最重要的是什么，以及它们如何添加到故事和主题中。是最精巧的场景调度，还是一系列的摄像机角度？如果您专注于单个场景或序列，声音、灯光和摄像机运动如何相互作用来评论或支持故事的动作？您如何将电影的形式特征与其主题联系起来？

Strictly speaking, formalist criticism does not emphasize matters outside the film proper, such as the different effects a movie may have on audiences, the historical conditions of its production, or any other questions that are not immediately apparent on the screen. (Rarely today, however, do you find an essay that is purely formalist; usually a formalist analysis becomes part of other arguments about an auteur, film history, a genre, and so on.) A purely formalist analysis might therefore investigate narrative unity in His Girl Friday (1940), in which the two main characters propel the plot along through a series of confrontations and crises that begin in their divorce and end in their marriage. A writer may carefully look for stylistic or formal repetitions in the editing or lighting of a movie and may then describe how they work in relation to the rest of the film. Another option is to choose a visually complex scene or sequence and describe how it works and why it is important to the movie. Early in Shane (1953), for example, there is a quick and involved exchange of looks among Shane, the farmer, the wife, and the child, an exchange that sets up the social relationships for the remainder of the movie; a formal analysis could explain how the camera communicates so much so quickly. Whether you are examining a single shot or a pattern of images, ask yourself what is most interesting and significant about the formal features and how they add to the story and themes. Is it the mise-en-scène that appears most crafted or, rather, a series of camera angles? If you concentrate on a single scene or sequence, how do the sound, lighting, and camera movement interact to comment on or support the action of the story? How would you connect the formal features of the film with its themes?

思想

IDEOLOGY

 

从某种意义上说，意识形态是一种更微妙、更广泛的政治表达方式，至少如果我们将政治视为我们生活和世界观的基础的思想或信仰的话。意识形态可能指一个人对家庭神圣性的信仰，或另一个人对文明基本上是进步的感觉。当我们观看《战舰波将金号》（1925 年）、《卢旺达饭店》（2004 年）或《客户 9：艾略特·斯皮策的兴衰》 （2010 年）等电影时，几乎不可能会误解每部影片所传达的不同政治信息。第一个赞扬俄罗斯社会主义革命的力量；第二个描述了一家酒店的英雄事迹经理保罗·鲁塞萨巴吉纳 (Paul Rusesabagina)，他从胡图族民兵手中拯救了一千多名图西族难民；第三部分探讨了可能导致 2008 年纽约州州长辞职的阴谋性性丑闻。然而，不太明显的可能是电影《音乐之声》（1965 年）、《音乐之声》（1965 年）、 《英国病人》(1996)、《无间行者》 (2007) 或《龙纹身的女孩》 (2009)。与大多数电影一样，这些电影主要以娱乐为目的，它们的制作者可能会对任何声称其中存在无意的社会或政治观点的说法感到不满。然而，我们大多数人可能会承认，每一个都包含有关个人主义、性别关系、家庭生活的重要性、种族或欧洲历史的相当清晰的意识形态信息。同样，我们中的许多人可能会将《教父 II》（1974）视为一部令人兴奋且制作精良的黑帮电影，但对电影中意识形态价值观敏感的作家可能会将这些元素视为另一种视角的一部分，即与黑帮业务有关的视角。资本主义：

In one sense, ideology is a more subtle and expansive way of saying politics, at least if we think of politics as the ideas or beliefs on which we base our lives and our vision of the world. Ideology might refer to one person’s belief in the sanctity of the family or another person’s sense that civilization is basically progressive. When we see a movie such as The Battleship Potemkin (1925), Hotel Rwanda (2004), or Client 9: The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer (2010), there is little chance of mistaking the different political messages at work in each. The first hails the force of a socialist revolution in Russia; the second describes the heroics of a hotel manager, Paul Rusesabagina, who saves over a thousand Tutsi refugees from the Hutu militia; and the third examines a possibly conspiratorial sex scandal that led to the resignation of the governor of New York in 2008. Less obvious, however, may be the messages about life and society communicated in films such as The Sound of Music (1965), The English Patient (1996), The Departed (2007), or The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2009). Like the majority of movies, these films present themselves as mainly entertainment, and their makers would probably resent any claim that there are unintended social or political perspectives at work here. Yet most of us would probably acknowledge that each of these has rather clear ideological messages about individualism, gender relations, the importance of family life, race, or European history. Similarly, many of us might see The Godfather II (1974) as an exciting and well-made gangster film, but a writer sensitive to the ideological values in the movie might see those elements as part of another perspective, one concerned with the business of capitalism:

《教父2》清楚地表明了基本资产阶级价值观的破坏和/或无法获得。它们之所以被摧毁，并不是因为它们本身不充分；而是因为它们本身不充分。家庭关系、社会流动性、对安全的追求、男性陪伴，甚至宗教价值观都与人类对社区、爱、尊重、支持、欣赏的真正普遍需求相关并对应。科波拉证明，柯里昂家族赖以提供和保护这些价值观的社会制度——核心家庭、黑手党家庭、种族社区和教会——在资本主义的非理性、破坏性力量面前枯萎了，资本主义的主要目标是利润，而不是资本主义。人类需求的满足。

Godfather II clearly shows the destruction and/or unobtainability of the basic bourgeois values. They are not destroyed because they are inadequate per se; family ties, social mobility, quest for security, male companionship, and even religious values all relate and correspond to real universal human needs for community, love, respect, support, appreciation. Coppola demonstrates that the social institutions—nuclear family, Mafia family, ethnic community, and the Church—upon which the Corleones relied to provide and protect these values withered before the irrational, destructive forces of capitalism, the main goal of which is profit, not the meeting of human needs.

 

科波拉建立、交织并最终摧毁了四个层次的家庭联系——核心家庭、黑手党家庭、少数民族社区和天主教会。通过仔细的并置，他展示了每个人如何努力创建一个理想的社区，但没有成功。在所有情况下，商业需求都会破坏这些协会可能提供的任何公共方面。事实上，正是保护和支持这些家庭的努力被商业腐蚀并摧毁了他们。《教父二》在人类关系层面上阐述了马克思的洞察力，即资本主义即使在最好的情况下也必须摧毁人类的生活和交往才能存在。因此，资产阶级社会越是积极地努力实现它为自己设定的理想，它就越具有破坏性和腐败性。这种矛盾在美国黑帮中表现得最为明显，它是美国资本主义的完美缩影。（赫斯11）

Coppola builds up, interweaves, and finally destroys four levels of familial affiliations—the nuclear family, the Mafia family, the ethnic community, and the Catholic Church. Through careful juxtaposition, he shows how each strives unsuccessfully to create an ideal community. In all cases, the needs of business destroy whatever communal aspects these associations might provide. In fact, it is the very effort to conserve and support these families that becomes corrupted by business and destroys them. Godfather II works out on the level of human relations Marx’s insight that capitalism, even at its best, must destroy human life and associations to exist. Thus, the more vigorously bourgeois society strives to achieve the ideals it has set for itself, the more destructive and corrupt it becomes. And this contradiction is most clearly visible in American gangsterdom, the perfect microcosm of American capitalism. (Hess 11)

 

在与意识形态相协调的批判性写作中，任何文化产品或创作都隐含或明确地承载着关于世界如何或应该如何的想法以及男人和女人应该如何看待对方：你穿的衣服表达了社会价值观，就像你看的电影表达了社会价值观一样。无论我们同意还是不同意某一部电影所表达的价值观，意识形态批评家都坚持认为，这些电影绝不是对世界的纯真想象，其中看似自然的社会和个人价值观需要分析。这类优秀的写作通常会避免像《绿色贝雷帽》（1968）这样的电影中明显的政治宣传，在这部电影中天真地赞扬美国在越南的存在，而是探讨像《米拉》这样的电影中更微妙、更不明确的政治。奈尔的《密西西比玛莎拉》（1991），电影制片人在其中讲述了一个发生在美国南部的复杂的跨种族浪漫故事。

In critical writing attuned to ideology, any cultural product or creation carries, implicitly or explicitly, ideas about how the world is or should be seen and how men and women should see each other in it: The clothes you wear express social values just as the films you watch communicate social values. Whether we agree or disagree with the values expressed in a particular movie, the ideological critic maintains that these movies are never innocent visions of the world and that the social and personal values that seem so natural in them need to be analyzed. Good writing of this kind usually avoids the obvious politics of propaganda in a movie like The Green Berets (1968), in which the American presence in Vietnam is naively hailed, and instead looks into the more subtle and less definitive politics of a film like Mira Nair’s Mississippi Masala (1991), in which the filmmaker tells a complex story of interracial romance in the American South.

以下六种方法是当今电影批评的主要思想流派。每个人不仅关注电影本身，还关注观众制作和理解这些电影的方式：

The following six approaches are the principal ideological schools of film criticism today. Each attends not only to the films themselves, but also to the ways those movies are made and understood by audiences:

  • 对好莱坞霸权的研究集中于经典电影公式如何主导甚至有时扭曲人们看待世界的方式。
  • Studies of Hollywood hegemony focus on how classical film formulas dominate and sometimes distort ways of seeing the world.
  • 女权主义研究调查女性如何通过电影得到积极和消极的表现，通常特别关注女性电影制片人的历史，从二十世纪初爱丽丝·盖伊·布拉切的开创性作品开始，一直到当代导演，例如玛琳·戈里斯 (Marleen Gorris) 或苏·弗里德里希 (Su Friedrich)。
  • Feminist studies investigate how women have been both negatively and positively represented through the movies, often with special attention to the history of women filmmakers that begins with the pioneering work of Alice Guy Blaché at the beginning of the twentieth century and continues through contemporary directors, such as Marleen Gorris or Su Friedrich.
  • 种族研究集中在电影中对不同种族的描述，如拉丁裔、非裔美国人和亚裔美国人。
  • Race studies concentrate on the depiction of different races in films, such as Latinos, African Americans, and Asian Americans.
  • 课堂研究分析电影中展示的社会和经济安排，以说明社会权力如何在某些电影中和通过某些电影进行分配。
  • Class studies analyze the social and economic arrangements shown in a movie to illustrate how social power is distributed in and through certain films.
  • 后殖民研究从全球角度审视电影，旨在揭示以前边缘化或殖民文化（如印度或伊朗）中本土观点的压抑或出现。
  • Postcolonial studies examine movies within a global perspective, aiming to reveal the repression of or emergence of indigenous perspectives within formerly marginalized or colonized cultures (like India or Iran).
  • 酷儿理论研究了规范关系如何通过电影受到挑战或破坏，特别是通过与异性恋价值观的对抗。
  • Queer theory investigates how normative relations can be challenged or disrupted through films, especially through confrontations with heterosexual values.

意识形态批评的最佳例子试图避免将自己局限于电影的内容；相反，复杂的意识形态批评将有关人物和情节的问题与有关叙述的形状或镜头与人物的距离等更复杂的问题联系起来：例如，一部看到敌人的战争电影的意识形态点是什么只在一大群人中，或者在相机让他们看起来都很相似的情况下？（在这种分析中，意图或者电影制作人的主张不一定应该被接受为电影的真正内容。）

The best examples of ideological criticism attempt to avoid limiting themselves to the content of a movie; instead, sophisticated ideological criticism relates questions about characters and plot to more complex points about the shape of the narrative or the distance of the camera from the characters: What, for instance, is the ideological point of a war movie in which the enemy is seen only in large groups or in which the camera makes them all look alike? (In this kind of analysis, the intentions or claims of the filmmaker should not necessarily be accepted as what the movie is truly about.)

通过意识形态方法，首先尝试确定一部电影旨在传达有关其世界以及我们的世界的什么信息。它明确地表达了什么？它隐含着什么意思？这部电影对于人们如何相互联系或应该如何相互联系提出了哪些建议？个性重要吗？家庭重要吗？这部电影是否直截了当地讲述了这些价值观以及他们的要求，包括得失？这些价值观是否被描述为“自然”？如果是，为什么？这部电影是挑战还是支持观众的信念？为什么？电影的政治和娱乐方式如何交织在一起？特别是在与性别和种族相关的问题上，当今的意识形态批评提供了许多令人兴奋的观看电影的方式：电影如何描绘女性或少数族裔，电影如何排斥有色人种，以及中产阶级以外的观众如何看待电影。最重要的是，意识形态方法促使你对你通常认为理所当然的事情产生怀疑。

With an ideological approach, begin by trying to pinpoint what message or messages a film aims to communicate about its world and, by implication, our world. What is it saying explicitly? What is it saying implicitly? What does the film suggest about how people relate or should relate to one another? Is individuality important? Is the family important? Is the film straightforward and direct about those values and what they demand, both gains and losses? Are these values depicted as “natural,” and, if so, why? Does the movie challenge the beliefs of its audience, or support them? Why? How do the politics of the film and the way it entertains intertwine? Particularly with issues related to gender and race, ideological criticism today offers many exciting ways to look at movies: how movies depict women or minorities, how movies exclude people of color, and how movies are seen by audiences outside the middle class. Above all, ideological approaches urge you to be suspicious of what you might normally take for granted.

当您阅读和撰写有关电影的更多内容时，您将遇到其他撰写电影的方法，并将其添加到主要方法列表中本章中进行了描述。你会发现这些方法是重叠的，并且可以根据你想表达的关于电影的内容来不同程度地使用。撰写克日什托夫·基耶斯洛夫斯基的电影（例如 1993 年的《蓝色》）可能会让作者对基耶斯洛夫斯基作为导演的地位、他在波兰和法国电影中的地位以及他的电影的历史和形式特征提出疑问（a短篇甚至中篇论文不可能有这么大的范围）。因此，你永远不应该受到某种特定方法的过多限制，也不应该犹豫寻找其他方式来写电影。然而，了解这些模型并意识到何时可能使用它们对于组织您的思想和使您的写作集中注意力非常有价值。最重要的是，认识到观看电影和撰写电影的不同方式将使您能够选择最适合您自己的兴趣和目标的方法（图4.02）。

As you read and write more about film, you will encounter other approaches to writing about film to add to the list of principal approaches described in this chapter. And you will find that these approaches overlap and can be used with various degrees of emphasis, depending on what you wish to say about the movie. Writing about a film by Krzysztof Kieslowski (such as the 1993 Blue) would probably involve the writer in questions about Kieslowski’s status as an auteur, his place in both Polish and French cinema, and both the historical and the formal features of his films (a short or even medium-length paper is not likely to allow this much scope). You should consequently never be too restricted by a particular approach, nor should you hesitate to work out other ways to write about film. Yet knowing these models and being conscious of when you may be using them can be extremely valuable in organizing your thoughts and in bringing your writing into focus. Most important, recognizing different ways of looking at the movies and writing about them will enable you to choose which method or methods best suit your own interests and aims (Figure 4.02).

图 4.02 作为一位富有洞察力和灵活的作家，奥斯卡奖得主《贫民窟的百万富翁》（2008 年）对众多批评观点和方法做出了回应。除了对其声音和图像进行正式分析外，它还可以被视为一部具有宝莱坞音乐剧特征的类型片，一部具有导演丹尼·博伊尔其他电影主题的作者电影，甚至是一部具有复杂意识形态问题的电影关于阶级和性别。

Figure 4.02 For a perceptive and flexible writer, Oscar winner Slumdog Millionaire (2008) responds to numerous critical perspectives and approaches. Aside from a formal analysis of its sounds and images, it can be investigated as a genre film that shares characteristics of Bollywood musicals, as an auteur film with themes found in other films by director Danny Boyle, and even as a film with complicated ideological issues about class and gender.

 

论文样本

SAMPLE ESSAYS

 

第一篇文章由一位知识渊博的电影专业学生撰写，主要将弗里茨·朗的《M》（1931）视为德国电影传统的一部分，并在 20 世纪 30 年代初期的德国文化和政治的大背景下进行考察（图 4.03和4.04）。然而，请观察形式主义问题和作者论假设如何发挥作用。在第二篇文章中，一名刚开始对电影对女性的描绘感到不安的学生展示了对《普通人》（1980）的意识形态方法。更准确地说，她的文章是对这部电影的女权主义解读：它不太关心电影想要说什么，而是关心它确实讲述了女性在男性主导的社会中的表现。请注意，影片的这种“逆向解读”仍然非常接近图像和实际故事。

This first essay, written by a knowledgeable film student, examines Fritz Lang’s M (1931) primarily as part of a tradition of German cinema and within the larger context of German culture and politics of the early 1930s (Figures 4.03 and 4.04). Observe, however, how formalistic questions and auteurist assumptions also play a role. In the second essay, a student who began only with an uneasy feeling about a film’s portrayal of women demonstrates an ideological approach to Ordinary People (1980). More precisely, her essay is a feminist reading of the movie: It is less concerned with what the film intends to say than with what it does say about how women appear in a male-dominated society. Note that this “reading against the grain” of the film nonetheless remains very close to the images and actual story.

M·特里洛

M. Trillo

 

M的反思:作为危机文化的德国

The Reflection of M: Germany as a Culture of Crisis

 

弗里茨·朗 (Fritz Lang) 1931 M讲述了一个关于一名精神病儿童杀人犯的悬疑而恐怖的故事。仅其技术成就就值得关注：对声音的经济且富有想象力的使用、复杂的横切编辑以及有时像绘画一样详细和令人回味的图形构图。由于这些成就，M可能会始终吸引不同世代和来自许多不同国家的观众。但就我而言，朗的电影最吸引人的是它反映了 20 世纪 30 年代初期动荡的德国社会。无论是否有意识地以这种方式制作，《M》似乎都是德国法西斯主义崛起的镜像，但在反映这种崛起时，这部电影可能最重要的是试图将其暴露给德国观众。参与法西斯主义及其发展。

Fritz Lang’s 1931 M is a suspenseful and horrifying tale of a psychotic child murderer. Its technical accomplishments alone make it worthy of attention: an economic and imaginative use of sound, sophisticated crosscutting editing, and graphic compositions which are sometimes as detailed and evocative as paintings. Because of these accomplishments, M will probably always appeal to audiences of different generations and from many different countries. But for my purposes, Lang’s film is most intriguing as a reflection of a turbulent German society in the early 1930s. Whether consciously made in this way or not, M seems to work as a mirror image of the rise of fascism in Germany, but in reflecting that rise, the film may be most important as an attempt to expose it to the German audience that was so involved in fascism and its growth.

 

标题是对论文内容的具体、准确的描述。开头很一般但很吸引人。

The title is a specific and accurate description of the paper’s content. The opening is general but engaging.

 

图 4.03 街上的普通人变成了弗里茨·朗（Fritz Lang）的《M》（1931）中他自己的险恶倒影。

Figure 4.03 The normal man on the street becomes a menacing reflection of himself in Fritz Lang’s M (1931).

 

提出一个问题或问题——从而形成一个明确宣布且重点突出的论文。

A question or problem is stated—which leads to a clearly announced and focused thesis.

 

对文化和历史背景的简短但中肯的讨论。

A brief but pertinent discussion of cultural and historical background.

 

众所周知，20世纪20年代和1930年代初的德国文化陷入了危机。1919年至1933年间魏玛共和国的逐渐崩溃创造了一个似乎生活在某种混乱之中的社会或无序，即经济、社会和心理上的混乱。贫困、失业和抑郁成为普遍存在的现实，德国传统和秩序井然的社会中曾经存在的稳定的个人认同感似乎已经被第一次世界大战的灾难性失败所摧毁。这种普遍的混乱和不稳定反映了这一时期的许多主要文化趋势。挪威爱德华·蒙克的噩梦画作是这是整个德国表现主义艺术家流派非常有影响力的象征，他们的重点是日常生活安静表面下的黑暗、动荡的世界。弗洛伊德的著作也在这一时期变得越来越重要。这种日益增加的重要性尤其合适，因为他的作品讨论了男人和女人意识生活之下的黑暗无意识，并描绘了一个充满秘密不满的文明（威利特）。

German culture in the 1920s and early 1930s was, as is well known, caught in a crisis. The gradual collapse of the Weimar Republic from 1919 to 1933 created a society that seemed to live in a kind of chaos or disorder, a chaos that was economic, social, and psychological. Poverty, unemployment, and depression became widespread realities, and the stable sense of a personal identity once found in a German tradition and a very ordered society seems to have been destroyed by the catastrophic defeat of World War I. This general disorder and instability are reflected in many of the major cultural trends of the period. The nightmarish dream paintings of Norwegian Edvard Munch are the very influential emblems of a whole school of German expressionist artists whose focus was on the dark, turbulent world beneath the quiet surfaces of everyday life. Freud’s writings also became more and more important during this period. This increasing importance is especially appropriate since his work discusses the dark unconscious below men’s and women’s conscious life and also sketches a civilization full of secret discontents (Willet).

 

图 4.04 M的镜像。

Figure 4.04 The mirror images of M.

 

背景材料更具体地与艺术传统相关。

The background material is related more specifically to artistic traditions.

 

克拉考尔和洛特·艾斯纳表明，这一时期制作的一些最重要的电影描绘了一个“闹鬼的屏幕”，反映了社会不稳定的现实。从《卡里加里博士的内阁》到《吸血鬼诺斯费拉图》，许多电影似乎都经常讲述疯狂和破坏，甚至在现实的“街头电影”中，场景和情节也描述了一个正在崩溃的世界。在这些电影中经常控制混乱的暴君和疯子中，许多观众看到了希特勒的伏笔，卡里加里人将介入，利用危机的不安全感作为大规模破坏的工具（克拉考尔，艾斯纳）。

Kracauer and Lotte Eisner have shown, some of the most important movies made during this time depict a “haunted screen” reflecting much of the unstable reality of the society. From The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari to Nosferatu, the Vampire, many of these films seem regularly to be about madness and destruction, and even in the realistic “street films,” the settings and plots describe a world that is collapsing into ruin. In the tyrants and madmen that often control the chaos in these movies, many viewers have seen the foreshadowing of Hitler, the Caligari who would step in to use the insecurity of the crisis as a vehicle for massive destruction (Kracauer, Eisner).

 

引用了大部分信息的来源。

The source for much of this information is cited.

 

文化和历史背景进一步集中在两个关键的电影运动上，并通过引用特定的电影和两个学术来源来强调。在这一段中，作者提醒读者最初的标题和论文（“危机”）。同样，它成为主题句中有用的过渡词。

The cultural and historical context is further focused on two key film movements, highlighted with references to particular films and two scholarly sources. Throughout this paragraph, the writer reminds his readers of the original title and thesis (“the crisis”). Likewise, it becomes a useful transition word in the topic sentence.

 

20 年代的德国表现主义电影同样关注这场危机及其描述。第一句话既是过渡句（“这些”）又是主题句，指向对相关单部电影的分析。非常简短地概括了电影的中心主题。

The German expressionist cinema of the 1920s was likewise concerned with this crisis and its depiction. The first sentence works as both a transition (“these”) and a topic sentence, pointing to the analysis of the single film in question. Very short summary of the film’s central theme.

 

这些主题是《M》的核心，它借鉴了朗本人在 1920 年代工作的表现主义传统。主角贝克特（彼得·洛饰）是一个被某种无法控制的东西所附身的人，他有一种疯狂的冲动，想要谋杀儿童。在他平静的外表下，在日常生活中，这个疯狂的杀手开始让世界陷入混乱。在风格上，这部电影借鉴了德国电影的表现主义和“街头现实主义”传统。一方面，这种疯狂表现在许多表现主义镜头中，比如螺旋楼梯，表明了陷入困境和令人眼花缭乱的缺乏透视感。相反，社会贫困和黑社会生活的街头现实主义有时给《M》一种纪录片的感觉。值得注意的是，与一些表现主义电影不同的是， 《M》中很难区分心理混乱的梦境世界和街头的社会混乱。或者从故事的角度来说，朗在这部后表现主义电影中很难说贝克特到底是一个邪恶的疯子，还是某种贯穿整个社会的力量的受害者。

These motifs are central to M, which draws from that expressionist tradition in which Lang himself worked during the 1920s. The central character Beckert (Peter Lorre) is a man possessed by something he cannot control, a mad compulsion to murder children. Beneath his placid and calm exterior and in the midst of everyday life, the insane killer begins to throw the world into disorder. Stylistically, the film draws on both the expressionist and the “street realism” traditions of German film. The insanity is shown, on the one hand, in a number of expressionistic shots, like the spiraling staircases that indicate entrapment and a dizzying lack of perspective. Conversely, there is the street realism of social poverty and underworld life which gives M a kind of documentary look at times. Unlike in some expressionist films, it should be noted, it is difficult to distinguish in M between the dream world of psychological chaos and the social chaos of the street. Or to put it in terms of the story, Lang makes it difficult in this postexpressionist movie to say whether Beckert is an evil madman or a victim of some force that runs through the whole society.

 

作者仍然专注于电影，将形式和风格问题与更大的文化和社会历史联系起来。“相反”连接了对影响电影的两种德国电影传统的讨论。

Still focused on the film, the writer connects formal and stylistic questions to the larger culture and social history. “Conversely” connects discussion of two German film traditions that inform the movie.

 

主题句重申中心论点并引入分析。描述了具体、具体的例子，以及电影中的精确技术细节。插入了个人反思——巧妙地扩展了电影的主题。

Topic sentence reasserts central thesis and introduces analysis. Specific, concrete examples are described, along with the precise technical detail from the film. A personal reflection is inserted—one that intelligently expands the themes of the film.

 

这部电影有时相当明确地表达了这种混乱及其隐含的危机。这个气球成为贝克特受害者之一的象征，它有一个矮胖的人形，它与贝克特形状的相似可能表明凶手和受害者之间存在联系。通过朗的平行横切，寻找贝克特的警察的法律和秩序与寻找贝克特的黑社会犯罪团伙几乎没有区别。最后，还有精心策划的暴民场景（如最终审判期间），尽管如此，这些场景仍然像可悲的凶手看起来一样歇斯底里和嗜血。（在这些情况下，我情不自禁地想起纳粹以法律和秩序的名义实施的谋杀行为，或者想到成为战争机器的井然有序的士兵群体。）

The movie makes this confusion and the crisis it implies fairly explicit at times. The balloon, which becomes the symbol of one of Beckert’s victims, has a pudgy human shape, and its resemblance to Beckert’s shape might suggest a connection between the killer and the victim. The law and order of the police who search for Beckert are, through Lang’s parallel crosscutting, identified with and almost indistinguishable from the underworld crime mob that searches for Beckert, too. Lastly, there are the carefully orchestrated mob scenes (as during the final trial), which nonetheless appear as hysterical and bloodthirsty as the pathetic murderer seems. (In these instances, I can’t help but think of the murderous actions of the Nazis in the name of law and order or of the perfectly ordered crowds of soldiers who became the machines of war.)

 

过渡和总结（“那么，有”），然后转向文章的中心点：镜像。

A transition and summary (“There are, then”), which then moves to the central point of the essay: mirror images.

 

因此， 《M》中有许多双重形象或双重反思，似乎混淆了有关危机社会的问题。危机源自何处？哪里是有序，哪里是无序？什么是噩梦，什么又是现实？这种双重形象及其引发的问题在贝克特这个角色中最为明显，特别是在他和观众被要求审视他的形象的次数上。贝克特经常审视自己，在镜子中审视自己，寻找存在于他内心某处的疯子。有一次，朗让贝克特看着一家商店橱窗，贝克特的形象包含在电影图像的一个框架中——这个框架是由商店内以菱形排列的刀具的反射制成的。在这里，街上的普通人变成了他自己的威胁性反映。后来，贝克特发现他被发现了，并通过看到另一个镜像中的倒影而暴露了自己，该镜像显示了他背上的“M”字样。

There are, then, a number of double images or double reflections in M that seem to muddle the questions about a society in crisis. Where does the crisis originate? Where is the order, and where is the disorder? What is the nightmarish dream, and what is the reality? This double image and the questions it provokes are most apparent in the character of Beckert, specifically in the number of times that he and the audience are made to examine his image. Frequently, Beckert examines himself and sees himself in mirrors, searching out the madman that exists somewhere inside him. At one point, Lang shows Beckert looking in a shop window, where the image of Beckert is contained in a frame within the film image—a frame made by a reflection of knives laid out in a diamond shape inside the store. Here, the normal man-on-the-street becomes a menacing reflection of himself. Later, Beckert discovers he has been found out and exposed by seeing a reflection in another mirror image that reveals the telltale “M” on his back.

 

更具体的描述，涉及所看到的内容以及它的正式呈现方式。

More concrete description that attends both to what is seen and how it is formally presented.

 

这些不同的镜头和场景中的反射所暴露的并不完全相同。然而，在每一个事件中，人们都在寻找和发现自我（和社会）的黑暗面、混乱和杀戮冲动。此外，在大多数镜像中，摄像机将观众置于一个角度，以便观众似乎参与了反射——要么越过贝克特的肩膀观看，要么直接观看反射本身。正如影片对疯子贝克特产生了一种奇怪的同情一样，这些镜像似乎迫使观众在一个精神病杀手的反射图像中看到自己的阴暗面。

What the reflections expose in these different shots and scenes is not exactly the same thing. Yet, in each, it is the dark side, the disorder, the murderous impulses of self (and society) that are sought out and discovered. In most of these mirror images, furthermore, the camera places the audience at an angle so that it seems to participate in that reflection—looking either over Beckert’s shoulder or directly into the reflection itself. Just as the film builds up a strange sympathy for the madman Beckert, these mirror images seem to force an audience to view its own darker side in the reflecting images of a psychotic killer.

 

作者扩展了对某些主题和形式策略（“镜像”中包含的危机）的分析，以描述屏幕上的图像如何向观众提出和挑战。一些进一步的总结浓缩了（但不重复）论点。

The writer expands his analysis of certain themes and formal strategies (the crisis contained in the “mirror images”) to describe how the images on the screen address and challenge the audience. Some further summary that condenses (but doesn’t repeat) the argument.

 

如果说《M》与20世纪20年代末和1930年代初的其他德国电影一样，是对危机中的德国文化的间接反映，那么它也不仅仅是简单的反映。它结合了表现主义和街头现实主义两种传统，使噩梦变得真实，使现实成为噩梦，其方式比当时大多数其他德国电影更加令人不安。也许这就是德国当局在迫使朗改变原标题《我们中间的凶手》时所认识到的，因为他们认为这太过于政治挑衅。然而，几年后，当朗逃离纳粹德国时，他可能意识到，没有任何一部电影，即使是像《M》这样强大的电影，也不足以阻止德国街头浮现的残暴黑暗。

If M is, then, like other German films of the late 1920s and early 1930s, an indirect reflection of a German culture in crisis, it is also more than a simple reflection. Combining the two traditions of expressionism and street realism, it makes nightmares real and reality a nightmare in a manner far more disturbing than most other German movies of the time. Perhaps this is what the German authorities recognized when they forced Lang to change the original title, A Murderer Among Us, because they thought it was too politically provocative. When Lang fled Nazi Germany a few years later, he probably realized, however, that no movie, even one as powerful as M, would be enough to stop the tyrannical darkness that was surfacing in the streets of Germany.

 

这篇文章的要点得到了戏剧性的扩展，但这一次是关于电影制片人、电影背后的导演的历史。

A dramatic broadening of the main points of the essay, but this time in terms of the history of the filmmaker, the auteur behind the film.

 

参考文献

Works Cited

 

艾斯纳，洛特。闹鬼的屏幕。伯克利：大学。加州出版社，1969 年。印刷。

Eisner, Lotte. The Haunted Screen. Berkeley: Univ. of California Press, 1969. Print.

 

克拉考尔、齐格弗里德。从卡里加里到希特勒。普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，1947 年。印刷。

Kracauer, Siegfried. From Caligari to Hitler. Princeton: Princeton UP, 1947. Print.

 

威利特、约翰. 表现主义。纽约：麦格劳-希尔，1970 年。印刷。

Willet, John. Expressionism. New York: McGraw-Hill, 1970. Print.

 

标题简洁但明确地表明了与电影主题的争论或参与。开头段落介绍了对电影含义的共同理解，然后迅速陈述作者的替代“观点”。论文和论点集中在最后一句，通过与主角康拉德的具体联系进一步集中。

A title that succinctly but explicitly indicates an argument or engagement with the main theme of the movie. The opening paragraph introduces a common understanding about what the film means, then moves quickly to state the writer’s alternative “point of view.” Concentrated in the final sentence, the thesis and argument are focused further by being related specifically to the main character, Conrad.

 

平凡人中的不平凡女性

The Not-So-Ordinary Women of Ordinary People

 

《普通人》的表演很聪明，剧本很好，而且在评论界和经济上都很成功。这显然是对美国上层中产阶级的“诚实”观察，公正地记录了一个家庭的情感动荡和最终崩溃。然而，从另一个角度来看，这部被认为是诚实和公正的电影可以被视为对女性作为灾难或失败的代理人的精心构建。从这个角度来看，《普通人》中的女性始终是从男性的角度来看待和表现的，她们的作用主要是摧毁和扰乱电影主角康拉德·贾勒特本已摇摇欲坠的状态。

Ordinary People is intelligently acted, well scripted, and critically and financially successful. It is apparently an “honest” look at upper-middle-class America, presented as an impartial record of one family’s emotional turmoil and ultimate collapse. Yet, seen from another perspective, this supposedly honest and impartial movie can be viewed as a careful construction of women as agents of disaster or failure. When examined from this point of view, the women in Ordinary People are consistently seen and shown from a male perspective in which they function mainly to devastate and disrupt the already shaky state of the film’s protagonist, Conrad Jarrett.

 

主题句回顾了论文的主题，但将重点转移到男性关系的中心地位和女性的孤立地位上。

The topic sentence recalls the thesis but shifts its emphasis to the centrality of male relationships and the isolation of women.

 

母亲的负面特征特别是通过她在厨房里的行为而戏剧化——一个戏剧性的视觉空间，使作家能够整合剪辑、对话和图像构图的细节。

The negative characterization of the mother is dramatized specifically in terms of her actions in the kitchen—a dramatic, visual space that allows the writer to integrate details of the editing, the dialogue, and the composition of the images.

 

这部电影中充斥着男性的联系，但总是被令人反感的女性的威胁所掩盖，尤其是母亲贝丝令人毛骨​​悚然的角色。这种威胁的力量在日常饮食仪式中尤为明显，传统上，家庭领域是由被放逐到厨房的妇女控制和精心安排的。在这些饮食仪式周围和内部，我们最好地看到母亲方面微妙的暴力和操纵。例如，在影片的早期，康拉德在尝试自杀并随后住进精神病院后，努力恢复“正常”生活。父亲不经意间叫他来吃早餐，这让康拉德惊慌失措，一系列快速的镜头将他的痛苦与母亲高效、机械般的食物准备交织在一起。当他走进厨房时，看上去病怏怏而紧张，我们成了他的视觉伙伴，和他一起在早餐仪式中痛苦的紧张气氛中退缩：虽然对话表面上仍然很普通，但面孔和动作之间的快速编辑清楚地表明：和这位母亲一起吃早餐是令人焦虑的暴力。当他的母亲给他端上法式吐司并告诉他这是他最喜欢的时，他悄悄地说他不饿，一言不发，她把盘子迅速拿走，特写镜头显示她恶毒地把它塞进了垃圾处理器。父亲和儿子只能对这个不可预测的女性做出困惑的反应，在这个早期场景中，她已经被证明比易受惊吓的儿子更不平衡。

Male bonding pervades this movie but is always overshadowed by the threat of invidious females, especially the chilling character of the mother, Beth. The force of this threat is particularly evident during the daily rituals of eating, that domestic sphere traditionally controlled and orchestrated by women exiled to the kitchen. Around and within these eating rituals, we best see the subtle violence and manipulation on the part of the mother. Early in the film, for example, Conrad struggles to return to “normal” life after his suicide attempt and subsequent stay in a mental hospital. A casual call from his father to come to breakfast panics Conrad, and a swift sequence of shots interweaves his distress and the mother’s efficient, machinelike preparation of food. By the time he enters the kitchen, looking ill and nervous, we are his visual comrades, flinching along with him at the painful tension within the breakfast ritual: While the dialogue remains superficially ordinary, the quick editing between faces and actions makes it clear that breakfast with this mother is anxiously violent. When his mother serves him French toast and tells him it is his favorite, he quietly says he is not hungry, and without a word, she whisks the plate away before a close-up shows her viciously stuffing it down the garbage disposal. The father and son can only react with bewilderment to this unpredictable female, who in this early scene is already established as less balanced than the skittish son.

 

当家庭早餐明显被母亲破坏时，父亲卡尔文试图挽救局面，建议康拉德带他的男性朋友回家“在草坪上玩触身式足球”。他试图用一种仪式拯救另一种仪式，更确切地说，是一种用男性联系取代女性麻烦的尝试。卡尔文召唤了一整队男性来取代因母亲的惩罚性暴力而造成的破碎场景。然而，在《普通人》的这一点上，她的存在感太强烈了，父子的重聚必须通过一系列的叙事遭遇和启示来推迟。

When it is obvious that the family breakfast has been destroyed by the mother, the father, Calvin, tries to save the situation by suggesting that Conrad bring his male friends home to “play touch football on the lawn.” His attempt to rescue one ritual with another is more exactly an attempt to replace female trouble with male bonding. Calvin invokes a whole team of males to replace the shattered scene resulting from the mother’s punitive violence. At this point in Ordinary People, however, her presence is far too strong, and the reunion of the father and the son must be delayed through a full series of narrative encounters and revelations.

 

更具体的细节对于支持批评电影“预期”含义的论点很重要。请注意，电影中的事件不仅仅是用来叙述发生的事情，而是用来支持一个想法和一种解释。

More concrete detail, important to support an argument that critiques the “intended” meaning of the film. Note that incidents from the film are used not simply to recount what happened but to support an idea and an interpretation.

 

前面几段的一个强有力的转变是用“再次证明自己”这一短语。

A strong transition is made from the previous paragraphs with the phrase “asserts itself again.”

 

早餐场景结束后不久，母亲的出现再次出现，这次是在晚餐场景中，影片的风格生动地强调了这一点。场景以一个中长镜头开始，逐渐穿过餐厅门口。镜头保持严格平衡，门口的框架与胶片框架的两侧完美对齐，餐桌位于框架逐渐打开的中心。母亲在桌子的一侧，康拉德在另一侧，父亲在中间。在这个平衡的框架和平常的谈话中，康拉德似乎很安全。然而，母亲开始就他的“撕破的衬衫”向他施压，他立即从她的目光中退缩。当他回答另一个棘手的问题，说他已经很长时间没有打网球时，贝丝反驳道：“好吧，你不认为是时候开始了吗？” 当摄像机从低角度拍摄她很长一段时间时，她显得异常具有威胁性和高大。镜头的背景是父亲，他看起来很小，很不自在。快速的剪辑和特写强调了场景的原始平衡只是延缓了它最初伪装的碎片。

The mother’s presence asserts itself again shortly after the breakfast scene, this time in a dinner scene vividly underlined by the stylistics of the film. The scene opens with a medium-long shot that gradually tracks in through a dining-room doorway. The shot is rigidly balanced as the frame of the doorway lines up perfectly with the sides of the film frame, and the dining-room table is in the gradually opening center of the frame. The mother is at one side of the table, Conrad at the other, and the father in the center. Within this balanced frame and the commonplace conversation, Conrad seems safe. The mother begins, though, to press him about his “torn shirt,” and he immediately shrinks from her gaze. When he answers another demanding question by saying he hasn’t played tennis in a long time, Beth snaps back, “Well, don’t you think it’s time you started?” appearing unusually threatening and tall as the camera holds on her from a low angle for a noticeably long time. In the background of the shot is the father, looking small and uncomfortable; the rapid cutting and close-ups emphasize that the original balance of the scene was merely delaying the fragmentation it at first disguised.

 

精确描述的技术和风格证据。

Technical and stylistic evidence, described precisely.

 

作者继续在她关于“男性联系”和女性破坏的争论中交替使用两个关键点。与此同时，她将此描述为电影叙事将努力解决的一个“发展中”问题。

The writer continues to alternate the two key points in her argument about “male bonding” and female disruption. At the same time, she depicts this as a “developing” problem that the film’s narrative will work to solve.

 

在母亲的攻击性攻击之后，卡尔文再次试图与儿子建立联系（这正是这个“普通”时刻的描述方式）。他向康拉德询问他在医院的女性朋友的名字，观众知道这个人对康拉德很重要。贝丝随后立即离开餐桌，仿佛要放弃这个令人反感的话题（可能还有另一位女性的竞争），从而宣布她对现场的隐性控制。从那时起，她的身体就不再出现在桌子上，但她在镜头后面监督这两名男性时，她的控制能力很强。知道这一点后，他们交换了沉默但有意义的眼神，这是迄今为止相机在母亲专横的目光下允许他们进行的唯一真正的交流。

Calvin again attempts to bond with his son in the wake of the mother’s aggressive attack (which is exactly how this “ordinary” moment is portrayed). He asks Conrad the name of his female friend from the hospital, a person who the audience knows is important to Conrad. Beth then immediately announces her implicit control of the scene by leaving the table as if to abandon the distasteful topic (and probably the competition of another female). From that point on, she is physically absent from the table yet very much in control as she oversees the two males from the back of the shot. Knowing this, they exchange silent but meaningful glances, the only real communication the camera has so far allowed them while under the tyrannical eyes of the mother.

 

更具体的细节对于支持批评电影“预期”含义的论点很重要。请注意，电影中的事件不仅仅是用来叙述发生的事情，而是用来支持一个想法和一种解释。

More concrete detail, important to support an argument that critiques the “intended” meaning of the film. Note that incidents from the film are used not simply to recount what happened but to support an idea and an interpretation.

 

这一论点的一个重大扩展是，母亲所代表的危机是电影中女性面临的更大问题的一部分。

A major expansion of the argument claims that the crisis the mother represents is part of a much larger problem with women in the film.

 

必须强调的是，这些例子并不是简单地描述一个关于坏女人和坏母亲的故事。《凡夫俗子》里的女人都是无能的；所有女人都辜负了康拉德。他与医院里的朋友凯伦的会面，尽管有承诺，却特别令人失望。她小心翼翼地否认了他们在医院建立的友谊，将谈话（适当地在一家餐馆）集中在她恢复正常的新外表以及她对“平凡”世界的适应上。学校的戏剧比她和康拉德在医院里的亲密关系重要得多：“那是医院；那是医院。” 这就是真实的世界。” 她身上散发出的开朗和热情是康拉德困扰的精神所无法比拟的，在很多方面，她似乎正在成为康拉德母亲的翻版，只对外表感兴趣，无法对男性的“实质”做出反应。

These examples do not, it must be emphasized, describe simply a tale about one bad woman and mother. All the females in Ordinary People are inept; all women fail Conrad. His meeting with Karen, the friend from the hospital, is, despite its promise, especially disappointing. She carefully denies the friendship they formed at the hospital by concentrating the conversation (appropriately in a restaurant) on her new appearance of normality and her adjustment to an “ordinary” world.
