经验丰富的研究人员经常利用档案或与发行商的特殊安排来查看多年来被损坏或剪切的电影的权威版本。通常既无法使用也不需要这些设施的学生必须找到更简单的方法来观看他们正在学习的电影。如今，DVD 和数字下载（通过 Netflix、iTunes、Amazon Unbox 或其他“视频点播”互联网服务）替代或补充了电影本身。然而，出于多种原因，必须谨慎和怀疑地观看这些形式的电影。许多电影，从《十诫》（1956 年）到《贝奥武夫》（2007 年），都依赖于宽银幕图像（或者，就后者而言，是巨大的 IMAX 图像），因此即使是电视屏幕的信箱格式，图像与其原始图像有很大不同。最后，家庭观看条件对电影产生的反应与影院放映的反应截然不同。如果观众在电影屏幕上观看其中一部影片，然后再观看格里菲斯的《不宽容》 （1916 年）、希区柯克的《迷魂记》 （1958 年）、库布里克的《2001 年太空漫游》（1968 年）或詹姆斯·卡梅隆的《阿凡达》（2009 年），他们可能会有截然不同的体验。视频监视器或 iPod。

A seasoned researcher often uses archives or special arrangements with distributors to view authoritative versions of movies that have been damaged or cut through the years. Students, who usually have neither access to nor need of these facilities, must discover easier ways to view the films they are studying. Today, DVDs and digital downloads (through Netflix, iTunes, Amazon Unbox, or other “video-on-demand” Internet services ) substitute for or supplement the films themselves. These forms of film, however, must be viewed with caution and skepticism for several reasons. Many films, from The Ten Commandments (1956) to Beowulf (2007), rely on a wide-screen image (or, in the case of the latter, the gigantic IMAX image), so that even in letterbox formats for television screens, the image is dramatically different from its original. Finally, home viewing conditions create a kind of response to a movie very different from that to a theatrical screening. Viewers may have very different experiences of Griffith’s Intolerance (1916), Hitchcock’s Vertigo (1958), Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968), or James Cameron’s Avatar (2009) if they watch one of these films on a movie screen and then on a video monitor or iPod.

然而，DVD、有线或卫星电影以及数字下载现在是最常见的电影观看媒体，否认它们对电影研究的价值是错误的。随着越来越多的电影以电视为目标，越来越多的导演在电影和电视之间来回穿梭，两者之间的审美和商业界限变得越来越不明显。事实上，现在我们在电影院看到的一些电影似乎是为电视屏幕制作的。更重要的是，不同观看技术的广泛使用以及光盘或电缆上外国和被遗忘的电影的复活使这些工具成为电影研究几乎不可或缺的辅助工具。作者应该尽一切努力首先在电影屏幕上观看电影，但是能够在光盘上或下载时进一步分析该电影的优势是相当大的。学生可以详细研究单个序列甚至单个帧；导演的其他电影或同一历史时期的其他电影可以进行比较。更多深奥的电影越来越多地通过音像商店而不是通过电影发行商获得。

DVDs, cable or satellite movies, and digital downloads are, however, now the most common media for watching films, and it would be a mistake to deny their value for film research. With more and more films aimed at television showings and with an increasing number of directors crossing back and forth between film and television, the aesthetic and commercial line between the two is becoming less distinct. In fact, some movies we see at a theater these days seem to have been made for the television screen. More important, the widespread availability of different viewing technologies and the resurrection of foreign and forgotten films on disc or cable make these tools an almost indispensable aid to film research. A writer should make every attempt to see a film first on a movie screen, but the advantage of being able to analyze that movie further on disc or as a download is considerable. A student can study a single sequence or even a single frame in detail; other films by a director or from the same historical period can be compared. More esoteric movies are becoming more available through video stores than through film distributors.

此外，许多 DVD 版本还包含“补充功能”，例如删除的场景、幕后纪录片、电影制片人的音频评论音轨、演员和工作人员的采访、故事板和制作剧照、影片年表，甚至批评文章。其中许多功能通常可以提供有关电影制片人做出的创意决策以及制作电影所涉及的技术流程的宝贵见解。通常，电影的 DVD 版本有加长版本（有时称为“导演剪辑版”）或“未分级”版本，因此与最初在影院放映的版本有所不同。这些“特别版”DVD 可以用于主流好莱坞电影（由环球影业、华纳兄弟等公司发行）、B 级类型电影（由 Anchor Bay Entertainment 等公司发行）以及外国或“艺术”电影（例如，通过 Criterion Collection 或 Kino International）。购买或租赁 DVD 的一些不错的在线资源包括：

Additionally, many DVD releases contain “supplementary features” such as deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes documentaries, audio commentary tracks by the filmmakers, interviews with the cast and crew, storyboards and production stills, filmographies, and even critical essays. Many of these features often provide valuable insight regarding the creative decisions made by the filmmakers and the technical processes involved in making a movie. Often, DVD releases of films are available in extended versions (sometimes called a “director’s cut”) or “unrated” versions and will therefore differ from the version originally shown in the theater. These “special edition” DVDs can be found for mainstream Hollywood movies (distributed by Universal, Warner Brothers, and so on), B-level genre movies (distributed by such companies as Anchor Bay Entertainment), and also foreign or “art” films (for example, through the Criterion Collection or Kino International). Some good online sources for purchasing or renting DVDs include the following:

标准集合 ( http://www.criterion.com )。国际艺术电影的著名杰作、好莱坞经典作品以及电影史上经常被忽视的瑰宝的 DVD 发行商。

The Criterion Collection (http://www.criterion.com). DVD distributor of the well-known masterpieces of international art cinema, Hollywood classics, and often-overlooked gems from film history.

 

Facets 多媒体 ( http://www.facets.org )。提供在线 DVD 租赁和销售的非营利组织。

Facets Multimedia (http://www.facets.org). Nonprofit organization providing online DVD rentals and sales.

 

Kino International：世界最佳电影 ( http://www.kino.com )。电影史上和世界各地许多最重要电影的 DVD 发行商。

Kino International: The Best in World Cinema (http://www.kino.com). DVD distributor of many of the most important films throughout film history and around the world.

 

Netflix ( http://www.netflix.com )。在线 DVD 租赁和流媒体电影。

Netflix (http://www.netflix.com). Online DVD rentals and streaming movies.

 

稻草人视频（http://www.scarecrow.com）。西海岸最大的音像商店，提供在线 DVD 租赁和销售。

Scarecrow Video (http://www.scarecrow.com). Largest video store on the West Coast, providing online DVD rentals and sales.

 

除了这些网站之外，其他网站还提供免费剪辑和有时整部电影的访问。通常，可用的电影很有限，很少包括当代电影：

In addition to these sites, others offer free access to clips and occasionally entire films. Usually the films available are limited and rarely include contemporary fare:

葫芦（http://www.hulu.com）。包含流行电影和电视节目的剪辑和剧集。

Hulu (http://www.hulu.com). Features clips and episodes from popular movies and television shows.

 

Ubuweb ( http://www.ubu.com )。允许用户下载文学、电影、视频和音乐史中的稀有文献，例如 1917 年的达达主义杂志或有关安迪·沃霍尔的纪录片。

Ubuweb (http://www.ubu.com). Allows users to download rare documents from literary, film, video, and music history, such as a Dadaist magazine from 1917 or a documentary on Andy Warhol.

 

YouTube ( http://youtube.com )。不断发展的收藏，范围从个人视频到经典电影；一个很好的来源，尤其是老电影。

YouTube (http://youtube.com). A continually evolving collection that ranges from personal videos to classic films; a good source especially for older films.

 

影片剪辑 ( http://movieclips.com )。允许用户比较同一导演或同一演员的场景或序列的博客、剪辑和视频。

Movieclips (http://movieclips.com). Blogs, clips, and videos that allow users to compare scenes or sequences by the same director or with the same actor.

 

元咖啡馆（http://metacafe）。一个提供体育、电视节目、电影和音乐的剪辑和评论的网站。

Metacafe (http://metacafe). A site that offers clips from and commentaries on sports and television shows and movies and music.

 
脚本

已发表的剧本是研究电影的主要来源。传统出版商和在线资源越来越多地提供电影剧本，但它们提供的信息种类却有很大差异。一位作家在研究剧本已出版的电影时可能会发现只有对话。有时，他或她还可能找到相机方向和详细的镜头复制品。有时，出版的剧本甚至可能包含有关电影的采访和文章。请记住，已发布的电影剧本可能与“拍摄脚本”和电影本身有很大不同；永远不要完全基于已发布的剧本进行分析。

Published scripts are a primary source for studying a film. Film scripts have become increasingly available from traditional publishers and from online sources, but the kind of information they offer varies a great deal. A writer researching a film whose script has been published may find merely dialogue. Sometimes he or she may also find camera directions and detailed shot reproductions. Sometimes a published script may even contain interviews and essays about the movie. Keep in mind that published screenplays of films may differ significantly from the “shooting script” and from the film itself; never base an analysis totally on a published screenplay.

二手来源：书籍、索引、期刊和电子资源

Secondary Sources: Books, Indexes, Journals, and Electronic Sources

电影书籍比比皆是；您应该通过检查图书馆中关于您的主题的可用资源来开始对二手资源的研究。查看“电影”、“电影”、“电影院”和“电影”以及更具体地涉及您的主题的标题。例如，如果您的主题涉及 20 世纪 30 年代的恐怖电影，请检查四个主要标题下的相关标题，然后在“恐怖电影”或“超自然”下查找标题。您还可以查看与您的主题相关的国家电影院的标题（例如“墨西哥电影院”）。在研究单个标题时，在记事卡上写下书目信息（作者、完整标题、出版商、出版地点和日期以及页码）是有效且实用的，即使您不使用所有这些标题。

Film books abound; you should begin your research into secondary sources by checking the resources in your library for what is available on your subject. Look under “Movies,” “Film,” “Cinema,” and “Motion Pictures,” as well as under headings that deal more specifically with your subject matter. If your topic concerns horror movies of the 1930s, for example, check for relevant titles under the four main headings and then look for titles under “Horror Films” or “The Supernatural.” You could also check the headings for those national cinemas that relate to your subject (e.g., “Mexican Cinema”). While researching individual titles, it is efficient and practical to write down bibliographical information—author, full title, publisher, publication place and date, and page numbers—on note cards, even if you do not use all those titles.

除了图书馆自己的馆藏之外，还鼓励学生在研究某个主题时利用数量不断增加的其他电子数据库系统。许多广泛使用的系统，例如学术索引、LexisNexis 或 ComIndex，都纳入了电影和电影研究的研究。更传统的研究来源，例如MLA 国际书目或Magill 电影调查，也可以在电子数据库中找到。经常检查你的研究图书馆员可以找出您图书馆中可用的数据库系统包含与您的工作相关的材料。从单个计算机屏幕访问这些信息通常是一种极其有效的研究手段。

In addition to a library’s own collection, students are encouraged to take advantage of the growing number of other electronic database systems when researching a topic. Many of the widely available systems, such as Academic Index, LexisNexis, or ComIndex, incorporate research on film and cinema studies. More traditional research sources, such as the MLA International Bibliography or Magill’s Survey of Cinema, can also be found on electronic databases. Always check with your research librarian to find out which database systems available in your library contain material pertinent to your work. Accessing these from a single computer screen is often an extremely efficient means of doing research.

一旦你收集了合适的书籍，你的任务就是从有时是一大堆的书中挑选出你需要的信息。一种快速入门的方法是扫描序言或封面，看看这本书是否有效地处理了这些材料。另外，浏览一下目录，看看章节标题是否指向你自己的思考方向。当您的主题涉及一部或多部特定电影时，请查阅本书的索引，了解您的电影被讨论的频率和充分程度。有些关于恐怖电影的书可能是无关紧要的“图画书”；其他的可能是详细的历史记录，只有在您更好地理解您的主题后才会变得有帮助。要将提供太少或太多信息的书籍与那些似乎最适合您的主题和电影的书籍区分开来，请选择一两本看起来最容易管理的书籍作为介绍性文本。如果它们被证明是令人满意且有帮助的，请使用它们的参考书目来引导您找到其他来源。

Once you have gathered the appropriate books, you have the task of culling the information you need from what is a sometimes large pile. One quick way to get started is scanning the preface or cover to see if the book deals with the material usefully. In addition, look through the table of contents to see if the chapter titles point in the direction of your own thinking. When your topic concerns one or more specific movies, consult the index of the book to see how frequently and fully your films are discussed. Some books on horror films may be irrelevant “picture books”; others may be detailed histories that will become helpful only after you have a better understanding of your topic. To separate the books that offer either too little or too much information from those that seem to address your subject and films most appropriately, select one or two of those that seem most manageable to serve as introductory texts. If they prove satisfactory and helpful, use their bibliographies to guide you to other sources.

除了可以在图书馆找到的电影专业书籍外，还有指南、百科全书和电影词典，可以快速获取有关电影、导演或电影运动的日期和历史信息。尽管这些很少提供对电影的分析或争论，但它们提供了可靠的事实信息和介绍性评论。在许多可用的中，以下是一个示例：

Besides the specialized books on film that can be found in a library, there are guides, encyclopedias, and film dictionaries that provide quick access to dates and historical information about a movie, a director, or a film movement. Although these rarely offer analysis of or argument about a film, they give solid factual information and introductory commentaries. Of the many available, here is a sampling:

美国电影学会美国制作的电影目录：故事片，1911-1970 年。5卷。伯克利：加州大学出版社，1989-97。

The American Film Institute Catalogue of Motion Pictures Produced in the United States: Feature Films, 1911–1970. 5 vols. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1989–97.

 

阿舍尔、史蒂文等人。电影制片人手册：数字时代的综合指南。纽约：羽，1999。

Ascher, Steven, et al. The Filmmaker’s Handbook: A Comprehensive Guide for the Digital Age. New York: Plume, 1999.

 

巴斯金、艾伦. 恩瑟拍摄的书籍和戏剧：1928-2001 年拍成电影的书籍和戏剧清单。英国奥尔德肖特：阿什盖特，2003 年。

Baskin, Ellen. Enser’s Filmed Books and Plays: A List of Books and Plays from Which Films Have Been Made, 1928–2001. Aldershot, England: Ashgate, 2003.

 

鲍登，莉兹·安妮，编辑。牛津电影伴侣。纽约：牛津大学出版社，1976 年。

Bawden, Liz-Anne, ed. The Oxford Companion to Film. New York: Oxford University Press, 1976.

 

史蒂夫·布兰德福德等人编辑。电影研究词典。纽约：牛津大学出版社，2001 年。

Blandford, Steve, et al., eds. The Film Studies Dictionary. New York: Oxford University Press, 2001.

 

考伊，彼得，编辑。综艺国际电影指南。洛杉矶：西尔曼·詹姆斯出版社，1964 年–。年度的。

Cowie, Peter, ed. Variety International Film Guide. Los Angeles: Silman James Press, 1964–. Annual.

 

迪贾，埃迪，编辑。BFI 电影电视手册。伦敦：BFI，2001 年–。年度的。

Dyja, Eddie, ed. BFI Film and Television Handbook. London: BFI, 2001–. Annual.

 

埃尔塞瑟，托马斯，编辑。BFI 德国电影伴侣。伦敦：BFI，2000 年。

Elsaesser, Thomas, ed. The BFI Companion to German Cinema. London: BFI, 2000.

 

电影日报年鉴。纽约：电影日报出版社，1918 年–。年度的。

Film Daily Year Book of Motion Pictures. New York: Film Daily Publishers, 1918–. Annual.

 

莱斯利·哈利韦尔和约翰·沃克编辑。哈利韦尔的电影名人录。第 15 版。纽约：哈珀柯林斯出版社，2003 年。

Halliwell, Leslie, and John Walker, eds. Halliwell’s Who’s Who in the Movies. 15th ed. New York: HarperCollins, 2003.

 

约翰·希尔和帕梅拉·丘奇·吉布森。牛津电影研究指南。纽约：牛津大学出版社，1998 年。

Hill, John, and Pamela Church Gibson. The Oxford Guide to Film Studies. New York: Oxford University Press, 1998.

 

卡普兰，迈克，编辑。综艺国际演艺界参考。纽约：加兰，1981。

Kaplan, Mike, ed. Variety International Showbusiness Reference. New York: Garland, 1981.

 

卡茨，以法莲。电影百科全书。第四版。纽约：哈珀柯林斯出版社，2001 年。

Katz, Ephraim. The Film Encyclopedia. 4th ed. New York: HarperCollins, 2001.

 

柯尼斯堡，艾拉。完整的电影词典。第二版。纽约：企鹅出版社，1997 年。

Konigsberg, Ira. The Complete Film Dictionary. 2nd ed. New York: Penguin, 1997.

 

科扎斯基，理查德，编辑。好莱坞导演，1914 年至 1940 年。纽约：牛津大学出版社，1976 年。

Kozarski, Richard, ed. Hollywood Directors, 1914–1940. New York: Oxford University Press, 1976.

 

科扎斯基，理查德，编辑。好莱坞导演，1941 年至 1976 年。纽约：牛津大学出版社，1977 年。

Kozarski, Richard, ed. Hollywood Directors, 1941–1976. New York: Oxford University Press, 1977.

 

马吉尔的电影调查。新泽西州恩格尔伍德悬崖：Magill，1983 年–。年度的。

Magill’s Survey of Cinema. Englewood Cliffs, N.J.: Magill, 1983–. Annual.

 

马尔丁、伦纳德. 伦纳德·马尔丁的电影百科全书。纽约：Plume Books，1994。

Maltin, Leonard. Leonard Maltin’s Movie Encyclopedia. New York: Plume Books, 1994.

 

马尔丁，伦纳德，编辑。电影和视频指南。纽约：Plume/Penguin Books，1969–。年度的。

Maltin, Leonard, ed. Movie and Video Guide. New York: Plume/Penguin Books, 1969–. Annual.

 

国际电影年鉴。纽约：奎格利，1928 年–。年度的。

The International Motion Picture Almanac. New York: Quigley, 1928–. Annual.

 

《纽约时报》电影评论，1913 年至 1970 年。7 卷。纽约：阿诺，1971 年。

The New York Times Film Reviews, 1913–1970. 7 vols. New York: Arno, 1971.

 

纽约时报电影评论，1975-2001。13 卷。纽约：劳特利奇，1988-2001。

The New York Times Film Reviews, 1975–2001. 13 vols. New York: Routledge, 1988–2001.

 

诺厄尔-史密斯，杰弗里。牛津世界电影史。纽约：牛津大学出版社，1996 年。

Nowell-Smith, Geoffrey. The Oxford History of World Cinema. New York: Oxford University Press, 1996.

 

Rajadhyaksha、Anish 和 Paul Willemen，编辑。印度电影百科全书。第二次修订。编辑。伦敦：BFI，1999 年。

Rajadhyaksha, Anish, and Paul Willemen, eds. Encyclopedia of Indian Cinema. 2nd rev. ed. London: BFI, 1999.

 

罗德，理查德，编辑。电影：批评词典。纽约：维京人，1980。

Roud, Richard, ed. Cinema: A Critical Dictionary. New York: Viking, 1980.

 

萨杜尔、乔治. 电影制片人词典。跨。和编辑。彼得·莫里斯. 伯克利：加州大学出版社，1972 年。

Sadoul, Georges. Dictionary of Film Makers. Trans. and ed. Peter Morris. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1972.

 

萨杜尔、乔治. 电影词典。跨。和编辑。彼得·莫里斯. 伯克利：加州大学出版社，1972 年。

Sadoul, Georges. Dictionary of Films. Trans. and ed. Peter Morris. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1972.

 

萨里斯、安德鲁. 美国电影：导演和方向，1929-1968。纽约：达顿，1968 年。

Sarris, Andrew. The American Cinema: Directors and Directions, 1929–1968. New York: Dutton, 1968.

 

斯皮德、F. 莫里斯和詹姆斯·卡梅伦-威尔逊。影评。伦敦：WH 艾伦，1966 年–。年度的。

Speed, F. Maurice, and James Cameron-Wilson. Film Review. London: W. H. Allen, 1966–. Annual.

 

斯坦伯格、科贝特。卷轴事实：电影记录大全。更新。纽约：复古，1982 年。

Steinberg, Cobbett. Reel Facts: The Movie Book of Records. Updated. New York: Vintage, 1982.

 

泰勒、理查德等人编辑。BFI 东欧和俄罗斯电影伴侣。伦敦：BFI，2000 年。

Taylor, Richard, et al., eds. The BFI Companion to Eastern European and Russian Cinema. London: BFI, 2000.

 

托马斯，尼古拉斯，编辑。国际电影和电影制片人词典。第二版。5卷。芝加哥：圣詹姆斯出版社，1990-94。

Thomas, Nicholas, ed. The International Dictionary of Films and Filmmakers. 2nd ed. 5 vols. Chicago: St. James Press, 1990–94.

 

汤姆森、大卫. 新传记电影词典：扩展和更新。纽约：克诺夫，2004 年。

Thomson, David. The New Biographical Dictionary of Film: Expanded and Updated. New York: Knopf, 2004.

 

威利斯，约翰，编辑。银幕世界电影年鉴。伦敦：掌声，1949–。

Willis, John, ed. Screen World Film Annual. London: Applause, 1949–.

 

电影研究最重要和最新的来源以及学术书籍是期刊和杂志。作家逐渐熟悉它们之间的差异，学会判断哪些对哪些主题最有帮助。这里的文章和评论提供了一系列信息：对演员、编剧和导演的采访；电影制作的背景事实；以及对复杂关键问题的调查（例如政治或电影的形式特征）。研究特定电影或主题的文章的第一步是扫描一个好的索引，该索引将列出有关您的主题的大部分文章和评论，并指出找到它们的期刊。但请记住，您查找的标题或信息可能位于“电影”或“电影”等标题下。

The most important and up-to-date sources for film research, along with scholarly books, are journals and magazines. A writer gradually becomes familiar with the differences among them, learning to judge which ones will be most helpful for which topics. The essays and reviews found here provide a range of information: interviews with actors, script-writers, and directors; background facts on the production of a movie; and investigations of complex critical issues (the politics or the formal features of the movie, for instance). A first step in researching articles on a specific movie or topic is to scan a good index, which will list most of the essays and reviews on your subject and will indicate the periodicals in which they are found. Keep in mind, however, that the titles or information you seek may be located under headings such as “Motion Pictures” or “Movies.”

除了更一般的索引，例如《期刊文献指南》和 MLA 国际书目的电影部分，以下是一些电影研究的标准索引：

Besides more general indexes, such as the Guide to Periodical Literature and the film section of the MLA International Bibliography, the following are a few of the standard indexes for film research:

阿塞托、文森特·J.、简·格雷夫斯和弗雷德·席尔瓦。电影文献 索引。纽约州奥尔巴尼：Filmdex，1973 年–。季刊。

Aceto, Vincent J., Jane Graves, and Fred Silva. Film Literature Index. Albany, N.Y.: Filmdex, 1973–. Quarterly.

 

巴蒂、琳达. 电影期刊回顾索引，1930-1971。纽约：RR Bowker，1975。

Batty, Linda. Retrospective Index to Film Periodicals, 1930–1971. New York: R. R. Bowker, 1975.

 

鲍尔斯，斯蒂芬·E.，编辑。英国和美国期刊影评索引，1930-1972 年。纽约：伯特·富兰克林，1973 年。

Bowles, Stephen E., ed. Index to Critical Film Reviews in British and American Periodicals, 1930–1972. New York: Burt Franklin, 1973.

 

鲍尔斯，斯蒂芬·E.，编辑。电影书籍评论索引 ，1930-1972。纽约：伯特·富兰克林，1975 年。

Bowles, Stephen E., ed. Index to Critical Reviews of Books about Film, 1930–1972. New York: Burt Franklin, 1975.

 

鲍尔斯，斯蒂芬·E.，编辑。电影选集索引。新泽西州梅图琴：稻草人出版社，1994 年。

Bowles, Stephen E., ed. The Film Anthologies Index. Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1994.

 

彼得·J·布卡尔斯基《电影研究：带有注释和论文的批评书目》。 波士顿：GK 大厅，1972 年。

Bukalski, Peter J. Film Research: A Critical Bibliography with Annotation and Essay. Boston: G. K. Hall, 1972.

 

电影索引：参考书目。3 卷。纽约：现代艺术博物馆电影图书馆，1941-85。

The Film Index: A Bibliography. 3 vols. New York: The Museum of Modern Art Film Library, 1941–85.

 

约翰·C·格拉赫 (Gerlach) 和拉娜·格拉赫 (Gerlach)。批判索引：1948-1973。纽约：师范学院出版社，1974 年。

Gerlach, John C., and Gerlach, Lana. The Critical Index: 1948–1973. New York: Teacher’s College Press, 1974.

 

国际电影期刊索引（FIAF 索引）。纽约：RR Bowker，1972–。年度的。

International Index to Film Periodicals (FIAF Index). New York: R. R. Bowker, 1972–. Annual.

 

科瓦尔斯基，罗斯玛丽·里比奇。妇女与电影：参考书目。新泽西州梅塔琴：稻草人出版社，1976 年。

Kowalski, Rosemary Ribich. Women and Film: A Bibliography. Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1976.

 

麦肯、理查德·戴尔和爱德华·S·佩里。新电影 索引：英文杂志文章参考书目，1930-1970。纽约：达顿，1974 年。

MacCann, Richard Dyer, and Edward S. Perry. The New Film Index: A Bibliography of Magazine Articles in English, 1930–1970. New York: Dutton, 1974.

 

媒体评论文摘。密歇根州安娜堡：Pierian Press，1970–。年度的。

Media Review Digest. Ann Arbor, Mich.: Pierian Press, 1970–. Annual.

 

摩纳哥，詹姆斯和苏珊·申克，编辑。关于电影的书籍： 书目清单。第三版。纽约：《西洋镜》，1976 年。

Monaco, James, and Susan Schenker, eds. Books about Film: A Bibliographical Checklist. 3rd ed. New York: Zoetrope, 1976.

 

雷劳尔、乔治. 麦克米伦电影参考书目。2卷。伦敦：麦克米伦，1982 年。

Rehrauer, George. The Macmillan Film Bibliography. 2 vols. London: Macmillan, 1982.

 

舒斯特尔、梅尔. 电影导演：杂志和期刊文章参考书目 ，1900-1972 年。新泽西州梅塔琴：稻草人出版社，1973 年。

Schuster, Mel. Motion Picture Directors: A Bibliography of Magazine and Periodical Articles, 1900–1972. Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1973.

 

查阅这些索引时，最好从最近几年开始，然后回溯到过去几年来查找相关论文；最新的文章通常包含更多最新信息。记录几年内的条目通常是一个好的开始。然而，一部刚刚上映的电影甚至可能不会出现在最新的索引中，在这种情况下，您必须检查最近几个月出现的最新期刊的目录和报纸上的电影评论。（一些期刊，例如《电影杂志》和《电影季刊》，定期列出有关电影的最新文章和书籍或评论。）注意：索引总是会使用期刊的极端缩写；请注意：索引将始终使用极端缩写来表示期刊。在离开索引之前一定要检查这些缩写的关键。

When consulting these indexes, it is best to begin with more recent years and then move back through the years to find relevant essays; the more current articles often have more up-to-date information. Noting the entries over a period of several years is usually a good start. A just-released movie, however, may not even appear in the most current index, and in this case, you must examine the tables of contents of the most recent journals and the movie reviews in newspapers that have appeared in the past few months. (Some journals, such as Cinema Journal and Film Quarterly, feature regular listings or reviews of very recent articles and books about film.) Caution: Invariably, an index will use extreme abbreviations for the journals; be certain to check the key to those abbreviations before leaving the index.

电影期刊的质量和关注点差异很大，以下标题列表表明了电影研究人员将遇到的期刊的种类和范围。一些期刊提供困难的理论论文，另一些期刊主要提供采访和简短的评论文章，还有一些期刊（如《Variety》）是贸易和行业信息的常规来源。尽管那些标有星号的文章对大学生特别有用，但您应该调查所有似乎与您的主题相关的内容。通过使用它们，您将熟悉它们的优点和局限性。除了这些更专业的期刊之外，大多数杂志和报纸，例如《新闻周刊》或《纽约时报》，都是电影评论和简短的一般文章的常规来源。期刊也变得越来越容易以电子方式获取，可以通过直接向期刊出版商在线订阅，也可以通过中介机构（例如Project Muse 等图书馆数据库）进行订阅。请向您的图书馆查询可供学生在线使用的期刊列表。此外，许多期刊都有自己的网站，经常包含过期期刊的目录，甚至样本文章。

Film journals vary considerably in quality and focus, and the following list of titles indicates the variety and range of journals that a film researcher will encounter. Some journals offer difficult theoretical essays, others have mainly interviews and short review articles, and still others (like Variety) are a regular source of trade and industry information. Although those marked with an asterisk feature articles particularly useful to college students, you should investigate all that seem to deal with your topic. By using them, you will become familiar with their advantages and limitations. In addition to these more specialized periodicals, most magazines and newspapers, such as Newsweek or the New York Times, are regular sources for movie reviews and short, general articles. Journals are also becoming more readily available electronically, either through online subscriptions directly with the journal publisher or through intermediaries, such as library databases like Project Muse. Check with your library for a listing of journals available to students online. In addition, many journals have their own websites that frequently include tables of contents for back issues and even sample articles.

以下列表中，特别推荐带星号的期刊：

In the following list, journals marked with an asterisk are especially recommended:



*改编（http://www.adaptation.oxfordjournals.org）。有关文学与电影之间的交流以及其他形式的电影改编的理论、评论和评论文章[每年两期]。



* Adaptation (http://www.adaptation.oxfordjournals.org). Theoretical, critical, and review essays concerned with the exchanges between literature and film, as well as other forms of cinematic adaptation [two issues annually].

 

美国电影摄影师( http://www.theasc.com/magazine )。短文和行业信息[每月]。

American Cinematographer (http://www.theasc.com/magazine). Short essays and industry information [monthly].

 

美国电影。评论文章和短文[1975-92]。

American Film. Review articles and short essays [1975–92].

 

明亮之光电影杂志( http://www.brightlightsfilm.com )。评论文章、短文、电影节和书评[仅限在线]。

Bright Lights Film Journal (http://www.brightlightsfilm.com). Review articles, short essays, and film festival and book reviews [online only].

 

*电影手册( http://www.cahiersducinema.com )。理论论文、当前电影评论和偶尔的采访[每月，法语]。

* Cahiers du Cinéma (http://www.cahiersducinema.com). Theoretical essays, current film reviews, and occasional interviews [monthly, French].

 

*暗箱( http://cameraobscura.dukejournals.org/ )。关于电影、电视和流行文化的理论和女权主义论文[每年三期]。

* Camera Obscura (http://cameraobscura.dukejournals.org/). Theoretical and feminist essays on film, television, and popular culture [three issues annually].

 

* Cineaste ( http://www.cineaste.com )。评论文章（通常针对意识形态问题）、采访和当前电影评论[每季]。

* Cineaste (http://www.cineaste.com). Critical essays (usually directed at ideological issues), interviews, and current film reviews [quarterly].

 

* Cinefex ( http://www.cinefex.com/magazine.html )。专注于电影院的特效技术[季刊]。

* Cinefex (http://www.cinefex.com/magazine.html). Focuses on special-effects technology in the cinema [quarterly].

 

*电影杂志（http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/cj）。批评文章[季刊]。

* Cinema Journal (http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/cj). Critical essays [quarterly].

 

*影院范围( http://www.cinema-scope.com )。国际电影评论文章[每年五期]。

* Cinema Scope (http://www.cinema-scope.com). Critical essays on international cinema [five issues annually].

 

*电影评论。关于女权主义电影批评和道格拉斯·瑟克等电影制片人等主题的评论文章、评论和特刊[每年三期]。

* Film Criticism. Critical essays, reviews, and special issues on topics such as feminist film criticism and filmmakers such as Douglas Sirk [three times annually].

 

*电影评论（http://www.filmlinc.com/fcm/fcm.htm）。当前电影、电影节和 DVD 发行的评论文章和评论 [双月刊]。

* Film Comment (http://www.filmlinc.com/fcm/fcm.htm). Critical essays and reviews of current films, film festivals, and DVD releases [bimonthly].

 

*电影哲学（http://www.film-philosophy.com/archive）。一份国际期刊，提供广泛的书评、理论论文和对单部电影的复杂分析。

* Film Philosophy (http://www.film-philosophy.com/archive). An international journal with a wide range of book reviews, theoretical essays, and sophisticated analyses of individual films.

 

*电影季刊（http://www.filmquarterly.org）。评论文章、偶尔的采访和当前的电影评论[每季]。

* Film Quarterly (http://www.filmquarterly.org). Critical essays, occasional interviews, and current film reviews [quarterly].

 

电影阅读器。批评文章[1975-85]。

Film Reader. Critical essays [1975–85].

 

电影事实。当前电影的简短评论[1958-77]。

Filmfacts. Short reviews of current films [1958–77].

 

电影和拍摄。短文和当前电影评论[1954-1990]。

Films and Filming. Short articles and current film reviews [1954–1990].

 

*框架（http://www.frameworkonline.com）。理论和批判论文[每两年一次]。

* Framework (http://www.frameworkonline.com). Theoretical and critical essays [biannual].

 

* 《女人与电影》。理论和批判文章，女权主义重点[季刊，德语]。

* Frauen und Film. Theoretical and critical essays, feminist emphasis [quarterly, German].

 

*图片：电影与流行文化杂志（http://www.imagesjournal.com）。评论文章、短文和访谈[仅限在线]。

* Images: Journal of film and popular culture (http://www.imagesjournal.com). Review articles, short essays, and interviews [online only].

 

*虹膜。批判性和理论性文章[不定期，法语和英语]。

* Iris. Critical and theoretical essays [irregularly, French and English].

 

*电影和视频杂志（http://www.press.uillinois.edu/journals/jfv.html）。关于电影、电视和视频的评论文章[季刊]。

* Journal of Film and Video (http://www.press.uillinois.edu/journals/jfv.html). Critical essays on film, television, and video [quarterly].

 

流行电影和电视杂志（http://www.heldref.org/jpft.php）。从文化研究的角度看影视评论文章[季刊]。

Journal of Popular Film and Television (http://www.heldref.org/jpft.php). Critical essays on film and television from a cultural-studies viewpoint [quarterly].

 

*跳切( http://www.ejumpcut.org )。评论文章通常针对政治和意识形态问题、当前电影评论和一些采访[仅限在线]。

* Jump Cut (http://www.ejumpcut.org). Critical essays often directed to political and ideological issues, current film reviews, some interviews [online only].

 

*文学/电影季刊（http://www.salisbury.edu/lfq）。关于电影与文学交叉点相关主题的评论文章[季刊]。

* Literature/Film Quarterly (http://www.salisbury.edu/lfq). Critical essays on topics related to the intersections of film and literature [quarterly].

 

*午夜之眼( http://www.midnighteye.com )。关注当代日本电影的散文、电影和书评以及采访。

* Midnight Eye (http://www.midnighteye.com). Essays, film and book reviews, and interviews focusing on contemporary Japanese cinema.

 

*千年电影杂志( http://mfj-online.org )。专注于独立、实验和前卫电影和视频的理论和评论文章[不定期]。

* Millennium Film Journal (http://mfj-online.org). Theoretical and critical essays focusing on independent, experimental, and avant-garde film and video [irregularly].

 

屏幕外( http://www.offscreen.com )。在线电影期刊，涵盖类型、导演和单部电影，以及电影节和其他期刊的评论。

Offscreen (http://www.offscreen.com). An online film journal that covers genres, directors, and individual films, along with reviews of festivals and other journals.

 

*视觉暂留。批判性和理论性文章[1984-97]。

* Persistence of Vision. Critical and theoretical essays [1984–97].

 

*积极的。批判性和理论性文章[每月，法语]。

* Positif. Critical and theoretical essays [monthly, French].

 

*电影和视频季度评论( http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/titles/10509208.asp )。关于电影和媒体的评论文章[季刊]。

* Quarterly Review of Film and Video (http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/titles/10509208.asp). Critical essays on film and media [quarterly].

 

胭脂( http://www.rouge.com.au )。一本国际电影杂志，收录了众多电影学者的电影评论、访谈和更广泛的主题。

Rouge (http://www.rouge.com.au). An international film journal with film critiques, interviews, and broader topics by a spectrum of film scholars.

 

*范围（http://www.scope.nottingham.ac.uk/index.php）。诺丁汉大学电影研究所杂志，包含评论文章、电影评论、学术书评和会议报告[仅在线]。

* Scope (http://www.scope.nottingham.ac.uk/index.php). Journal of the Institute of Film Studies at the University of Nottingham containing critical essays, film reviews, scholarly book reviews, and conference reports [online only].

 

*屏幕（http://www.gla.ac.uk/services/screen）。批判性和理论性论文[季刊]。

* Screen (http://www.gla.ac.uk/services/screen). Critical and theoretical essays [quarterly].

 

*电影感官( http://www.sensesofcinema.com )。评论文章、当前电影评论、电影节评论和采访[仅限在线]。

* Senses of Cinema (http://www.sensesofcinema.com). Critical essays, current film reviews, film festival reviews, and interviews [online only].

 

*视觉和声音( http://www.bfi.org.uk/sightandsound )。评论文章和当前电影评论[每月]。

* Sight and Sound (http://www.bfi.org.uk/sightandsound). Critical essays and current film reviews [monthly].

 

综艺( http://www.variety.com )。包含当前电影行业和商业信息的短文[在线和印刷]。

Variety (http://www.variety.com). Short articles with current film-industry and commercial information [online and print].

 

矢量：动态白话文化与技术杂志（http://www.vectorsjournal.org）。一本概念创新的期刊，将学术和分析与新的设计和交付技术相结合。

Vectors: Journal of Culture and Technology in a Dynamic Vernacular (http://www.vectorsjournal.org). A conceptually innovative journal that combines scholarship and analysis with new design and delivery technologies.

 

*天鹅绒光陷阱（http://www.utexas.edu/utpress/journals/jvlt.html）。批评文章[季刊]。

* Velvet Light Trap (http://www.utexas.edu/utpress/journals/jvlt.html). Critical essays [quarterly].

 

*广角（http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/wide_angle）。批判性和理论性论文[季刊]。

* Wide Angle (http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/wide_angle). Critical and theoretical essays [quarterly].

 

互联网上的电影研究

FILM RESEARCH ON THE INTERNET

 

互联网是一个不断增长的研究材料来源，尽管这些材料的质量差异很大。对于使用互联网的学生来说，万维网系统提供了讨论组、访问各种图书馆和媒体目录以及许多可以浏览信息的特定站点，例如香港电影页面、互联网电影数据库页面或电影评论杂志的页面。雅虎等服务 提供实时视频剪辑，并且许多网站提供可以下载和打印的电影静态图像。由于互联网上可用的资源和信息有望迅速增加，因此它们将提供独特的研究可能性。电影已经专为在互联网上发行和观看而制作，电影的录像带和 DVD 原本很难找到，但可以通过 Facets Video 等互联网网站租用。

The Internet is a growing source of research materials, although the quality of that material varies greatly. For students who use the Internet, the World Wide Web system offers discussion groups, access to various library and media catalogs, and numerous specific sites where one can browse for information, such as the Hong Kong Movie page, the Internet Movie Database page, or the pages of the journal Film Comment. Services such as Yahoo! offer live video clips, and numerous sites provide still images from films that may be downloaded and printed. Because the sources and information available on the Internet promise to proliferate rapidly, they will offer unique research possibilities. Already, films are being made exclusively for distribution and viewing on the Internet, and videotapes and DVDs of films, otherwise difficult to find, can be rented through Internet sites, such as Facets Video.

尽管互联网研究正在迅速成为电影研究的常见方式，但作家需要对网上找到的材料类型特别谨慎。最快、最简单，因此通常也是首选的途径就是选择一个搜索引擎，例如 Google，Yahoo! 或 Excite，然后输入电影标题或您想要研究的主题，例如“ 127 小时(2010)”或“土耳其电影”。虽然这是一个快速开始，但您的搜索结果可能会提供许多可能的网站和质量截然不同的来源。互联网上基本上有四种研究内容：

Although Internet research is fast becoming a common way to do research on movies, writers need to be especially cautious about the kind of material found online. The fastest, simplest, and consequently often the preferred route is simply to choose a search engine, such as Google, Yahoo!, or Excite, and type in the title of the film or the topic you wish to research, such as “127 Hours (2010)” or “Turkish cinema.” Although this is a quick start, the result of your search can offer many possible sites and sources of vastly different quality. There are basically four kinds of research content available on the Internet:

  • 一些网站和数据库提供有关电影以及参与该电影的个人（例如演员或导演）的基本事实。
  • Some websites and databases offer fundamental facts about a film and the individuals involved with that film, such as the actors or director.
  • 一些网站可能会提供来自参考期刊或学术期刊的完整评论或批评文章。该材料将由该领域的专家阅读和评估，并被认为对我们对该主题的理解做出了重要贡献。
  • Some websites may offer complete reviews or critical essays from refereed or academic journals. This material will have been read and evaluated by experts in the field and judged to make important contributions to our understanding of the subject.
  • 许多网站、列表服务器和讨论组没有权限或凭据。由于任何人都可以创建或进入这些网站，因此在那里发现的信息可能只不过是某人的观点或个人偏见。
  • Many websites, listservs, and discussion groups will have no authority or credentials. Because anyone can potentially create or enter these sites, the information found there could be little more than someone’s opinion or personal bias.
  • 现在上映的几乎每一部主要电影都有自己的网站。同样，几乎每个工作室和发行商都有一个网站。这里的信息范围从生产事实到八卦，通常包含评论和采访的链接。
  • Almost every major film now released has its own website. Likewise, virtually every studio and distributor has a website. The information here can range from production facts to gossip and usually contains links to reviews and interviews.

大多数图书馆都会提供组织电影标题和资源的数据库，并且可以通过个人计算机访问。其中一些向公众开放；有些仅限于该机构的订户或学生。此外，许多有用的互联网网站提供的信息范围从明星的故事和最近的电影评论到参考书目和理论论文。以下是此范围的代表（请记住，这些 URL 地址有时会发生变化、变得过时或需要调整）：

Most libraries will feature databases that organize film titles and resources and can be accessed through a personal computer. Some of these are open to the public; some are limited to subscribers or students at that institution. In addition, many useful Internet sites have information that ranges from stories about stars and recent movie reviews to bibliographies and theoretical essays. The following are representative of this range (keep in mind that these URL addresses sometimes change, grow obsolete, or need adjusting):

一般的

General

所有电影指南（http://www.allmovie.com）。提供电影和视频评论以及制作人员名单，按演员、导演和类型进行交叉引用

All Movie Guide (http://www.allmovie.com). Provides film and video reviews and production credits, cross-referenced by actor, director, and genre

 

电影院网站( http://www.cinema-sites.com )。数百个电影网站链接的综合列表

Cinema Sites (http://www.cinema-sites.com). A comprehensive listing of links to hundreds of cinema sites

 

互联网电影数据库( http://www.imdb.com )。提供有关电影行业、电影制作人员名单、情节摘要和电影评论的详细信息

Internet Movie Database (http://www.imdb.com). Provides detailed information on film industry, movie credits, plot summaries, and movie reviews

 

专业与学术

Professional and Academic

美国电影协会( http://www.afi.com )。提供最新的行业新闻、电影活动和节日、教育研讨会和研究生学位

American Film Institute (http://www.afi.com). Offers recent industry news, film events and festivals, educational seminars, and graduate degrees

 

伯克利电影研究资源( http://www.lib.berkeley.edu/MRC )。电影和媒体研究的在线参考书目和来源的集合

Berkeley Film Studies Resources (http://www.lib.berkeley.edu/MRC). A collection of online bibliographies and sources for film and media studies

 

Early Cinema.com ( http://www.earlycinema.com )。介绍早期电影的电影制作人、技术和社会环境，包括进一步研究的建议

Early Cinema.com (http://www.earlycinema.com). An introduction to the filmmakers, technologies, and social environments for early cinema, including suggestions for further research

 

电影文学索引（http://webapp1.dlib.indiana.edu/fli/index.jsp）。150 种电影和媒体期刊出版物的标准索引，包含 2,000 多个主题

Film Literature Index (http://webapp1.dlib.indiana.edu/fli/index.jsp). A standard index of the publications in 150 film and media journals with more than 2,000 subject heads

 

互联网档案馆( http://www.archive.org )。为研究人员、历史学家、学者和公众提供互联网站点和其他数字形式的数字实践的在线数字图书馆

The Internet Archive (http://www.archive.org). An online digital library of Internet sites and other digital practices in digital form for researchers, historians, scholars, and the general public

 

纽约州档案馆电影剧本收藏( http://www.archives.nysed.gov/a/research/res_topics_film.shtml )。提供完全可搜索的电影剧本集合，可免费供学术使用

New York State Archives Motion Picture Scripts Collection (http://www.archives.nysed.gov/a/research/res_topics_film.shtml). Provides a fully searchable collection of film scripts that are available free of charge for academic use

 

牛津书目在线( http://www.oxfordbibliographiesonline.com )。提供有关电影和媒体研究中各种关键主题的带注释和定期更新的参考书目

Oxford Bibliographies Online (http://www.oxfordbibliographiesonline.com). Offers annotated and regularly updated bibliographies on a wide variety of key topics in film and media studies

 

ScreenSite ( http://www.screensite.org )。提供有关电影、电影会议、档案的数据以及其他学术电影网站的有用链接

ScreenSite (http://www.screensite.org). Provides data on films, film conferences, archives, and useful links to other academic cinema sites

 

电影和媒体研究协会( http://www.cmstudies.org )。致力于电影、电视和新媒体学术研究的学术团体

Society for Cinema and Media Studies (http://www.cmstudies.org). Academic society dedicated to the scholarly study of film, television, and new media

 

耶鲁大学图书馆电影研究研究指南( http://guides.library.yale.edu/film )。在电影研究中进行图书馆和互联网研究的入门指南

Yale University Library Research Guide in Film Studies (http://guides.library.yale.edu/film). An introductory guide to conducting library and Internet research in film studies

 

当使用互联网进行研究时，学生需要区分实质性和有用的材料与聊天和无聊的评论。特别是对于互联网资源，有一些重要的经验法则需要遵循：

When using the Internet for research, students need to distinguish substantial and useful material from chat and frivolous commentary. Especially with Internet sources, there are important rules of thumb to follow:

  • 探索您自己的图书馆的数据库，看看那里有什么可用的内容。这是一种快速浏览与您的主题相关的电影书籍标题的方法。但请记住，这些数据库可能包含仅在特定日期之后出现的标题，并且应通过图书馆目录的搜索来补充它们。
  • Explore your own library’s databases to see what is available there. This is a quick way to scan titles of film books that bear on your topic. Remember, however, that these databases may contain titles that appeared only after a certain date, and they should be supplemented with a search of the library catalog.
  • 确定互联网来源在提供可靠信息或仔细评估论证和研究方面的质量。是来自参考出版物还是信誉良好的机构？其信息是否得到其他研究参考的支持？作者的资历是什么？
  • Determine the quality of the Internet source in providing reliable information or carefully evaluated argument and research. Is it from a refereed publication or a reputable institution? Is its information supported by references to other research? What are the credentials of the author?
  • 尽可能精确地定义您的搜索。除了电影标题之外，还可以将搜索重点放在“朱莉·泰莫 (Julie Taymor) 的《暴风雨》 (2010) 中的灯光”或“政治、新伊朗电影和巴曼·戈巴迪 (Bahman Ghobadi) 的《海龟会飞》 (2004)”等方面。通过“高级搜索”追寻您的主题。
  • Define your search as precisely as possible. Beyond just the title of a film, focus your search on, for example, “lighting in Julie Taymor’s The Tempest (2010)” or “politics, new Iranian cinema, and Bahman Ghobadi’s Turtles Can Fly (2004).” Pursue your topic through an “advanced search.”
  • 探索其他网站的链接。您对特定电影的调查是否会将您链接到讨论该导演的其他电影或相关问题（例如，关于电影类型或电影制作国家/地区）的网站？
  • Explore links to other sites. Does your investigation of a specific film link you to sites that discuss other films by that director or related issues (for instance, about the film genre or about the country in which the film was made)?
  • 为该网站添加书签，并复制您打算使用的材料，注明您访问该材料的日期以及任何其他重要信息。
  • Bookmark the site and make a copy of the material that you intend to use, dating when you accessed that material and any other important information.

记录二手来源

TAKING NOTES ON SECONDARY SOURCES

 

对二手资料做笔记需要判断。如果您在开始阅读时牢牢记住了一个想法或主题，您将需要决定什么支持、挑战或使该想法复杂化。如果您仍在试图澄清自己的论点，则需要以开放但有辨别力的心态来阅读，这样您就可以接受其他观点的指导，同时批评您不同意的观点。通常，阅读一篇关于电影的好文章会提供一个句子或一个段落来具体化你自己对电影的想法，并为你指明自己的道路。对建议持开放态度，并愿意遵循线索，无论是想法还是其他来源。

Taking notes on secondary sources requires judgment. If you have an idea or a topic firmly in mind as you begin to read, you will need to decide what supports, challenges, or complicates that idea. If you are still trying to clarify your own argument, you will need to read with an open but discriminating mind that allows you to be guided by other opinions while being critical of opinions with which you do not agree. Often, reading a good essay on a film provides the one sentence or paragraph that crystallizes your own idea about the movie and points you down your own path. Be open to suggestions and be willing to follow leads, whether they are ideas or other sources.

如果可能的话，首先快速浏览或阅读文章或章节以了解总体思路。然后，如果它看起来值得注意，请再读一遍。尤其是对于复杂的论文（甚至书籍），请尝试通过执行以下操作来集中和总结您的阅读：

When possible, quickly skim or read the essay or chapter first to get a general idea. Then, if it seems noteworthy, read it again. Especially with complex essays (or even books), try to focus and summarize your reading by doing the following:

  • 简洁地确定一个或多个要点
  • Identifying succinctly the main point or points
  • 分离出您认为最重要的一两个段落或句子
  • Isolating what you consider the one or two most important passages or sentences
  • 提出您对这篇文章的一个或多个问题（例如，关于您不理解的内容或您可能不同意的内容）
  • Formulating one or more questions you have about the essay (about, for instance, what you did not understand or what you may disagree with)

然后，开始准确记录阅读内容（即使在计算机时代，许多作家仍然使用 4 x 6 英寸的卡片，并且仅在卡片的一侧书写）。在做笔记时，它可能有助于识别和组织与特定主题或想法相关的材料（例如，通过在计算机上创建单独的文件或在每张卡片的顶部放置主题标题来帮助您根据论文的逻辑对卡片进行排序）。一旦您对一篇文章或某一章有了一定的了解，请使用以下一些准则将材料转移到您的记事卡或文件中：

Begin, then, to take exact notes on the reading (even in the age of computers, many writers still use four-by-six-inch cards and write on only one side of the card). In taking notes, it may help to identify and organize material that relates to a specific topic or idea (for instance, by creating separate files on your computer or by placing a subject heading at the top of each card to help you sort the cards according to the logic of your paper). Once you have a sense of an article or a chapter, use some of these guidelines in transferring the material to your note cards or files:

  1. 总结来源部分的想法，或准确引用可能有用的句子或段落。如果您使用精确的引文，请将其放在引号中。无论您总结还是引用，请务必注明有关来源的所有必要信息，包括页码。
  2. Summarize ideas from a section of your source, or quote exactly the sentences or passages that may prove useful. If you use an exact quotation, place it in quotation marks. Whether you summarize or quote, be certain to indicate all the necessary information about the source, including the page numbers.
  3. 直接引用句子或段落时，要有所区别。不要简单地复制看似重要但您尚未完全消化或理解的长段落。如果你仔细考虑以后可能对你的论点有帮助的段落，研究将有助于在早期阶段完善你的论点。没有人将从二手来源收集的所有注释或摘要合并到最终草案中。然而，如果你运用判断力并反思你所选择的材料，你就不会面对一大堆分散而不是澄清你的想法的笔记。
  4. When quoting sentences or passages directly, be discriminating. Do not simply copy long paragraphs that seem important but that you have not entirely digested or understood. If you consider carefully the passages that may be helpful to your argument later, the research will help refine your argument at an early stage. No one incorporates every note or summary gathered from secondary sources into the final draft. If you use judgment and reflect on the material you are choosing, however, you will not be faced with a massive pile of notes that have scattered rather than clarified your ideas.
  5. 切勿更改引用段落中偶尔出现的单词，并像摘要一样复制它。如果该段落出现在你的论文中，它看起来很像抄袭。
  6. Never change occasional words from a quoted passage and copy it as if it were a summary. If that passage appears in your essay, it will look very much like plagiarism.
  7. 有时，从引文中省略单词或短语是有利的，因为它们与你的观点无关。执行此操作时，请用省略号（三个间隔的句点）指示省略的部分。
  8. Sometimes, it is advantageous to omit words or phrases from a quotation because they are not relevant to your point. When you do this, indicate the omission with ellipses (three spaced periods).
  9. 无论你是总结还是直接引用，你都可能希望记下你对材料的回应，例如，“加尔佩林是唯一一个认识到这部电影有多么文学性的评论家。” 请务必用方括号或双括号从引用或总结的段落中清楚地标出这些反思。
  10. Whether you are summarizing or quoting directly, you may wish to jot down your response to the material, such as, “Galperin is the only critic to recognize how literary this movie is.” Be sure to mark off these reflections clearly from the quoted or summarized passage with either brackets or double parentheses.

写论文

WRITING THE PAPER

 

完成初步研究后，您将通过将该研究整合到论证的完成草案中来撰写一篇完善的论文。通常，研究论文的字数从两千到六千字不等（八到二十四页双倍行距打印页），作者应该始终使研究的数量和类型适合论文的长度。以下是一些指导原则：

Once you have done your preliminary research, you will move toward a polished essay by integrating that research into a finished draft of your argument. Normally, research papers are anywhere from two thousand to six thousand words (eight to twenty-four double-spaced, typed pages), and the writer should always make the amount and kind of research fit the length of the essay. Here are some guidelines:

1. 首先重读你所做的笔记，并将它们分类，例如“历史背景材料”或“主题”。当您开始关注主题时，并非您收集的所有信息都一定有用。一个好的作家学会区分什么是真正有用的，什么是没有用的。用大量的引文超载你的文章并不会改善它; 不必要的信息只会掩盖你的论点。如果您已经勾勒出轮廓，那么现在是时候根据您的研究重新设计它了。这种对大纲的修改可能只涉及微调，例如添加一些过渡部分或扩展部分。或者你可能必须重新思考你最重要的前提，改变和重组它以解释你最近的一些发现。如果你最初的方法是基于作者论假设，而这些假设与导演对特定电影的有限控制不一致，那么事实要求你重新阐述你的论点。当你为初稿构思你的想法时，你应该能够为论文提出一个相当清晰和精确的论点。

1. Begin by rereading the notes you have taken and sorting them into categories, such as “historical background material” or “themes.” Not all the information you have gathered will necessarily be useful as you begin to focus your topic. A good writer learns to differentiate between what is truly useful and what is not. Overloading your essay with an enormous number of quotations will not improve it; needless information will only bury your argument. If you have already sketched an outline, now is the time to rework it in light of your research. This reworking of the outline may involve only fine tuning, such as adding some transition sections or expanding a section. Or you may have to rethink your most important premise, shifting and restructuring it to account for some of your recent findings. If your original approach was based on auteurist presumptions that are out of line with the limited control the director had over the particular film, the facts require you to reformulate your argument. As you develop your ideas for this first draft, you should be able to state a fairly clear and precise thesis for the paper.

 

2. 完全按照最终草稿中的内容书写、键入或打印报价单。将简短的引文（四行或更少）放在引号之间，并将其放入文本中。较长的引文不用引号括起来；相反，它们会缩进并与您的散文分开三个空格。确保您准确地复制了报价。

2. Write, type, or print out your quotations exactly as they will appear in your final draft. Put short quotations (four lines or less) between quotation marks and run them into your text. Longer quotations are not enclosed within quotation marks; instead, they are indented and separated from your prose by a triple space. Be certain that you have copied the quotations accurately.

 

3. 将所有相关的书目信息添加到您的报价中。该材料稍后会出现在您引用的作品列表中，但将其放在您面前是有利的，这样您在完成最终草稿时可以轻松识别来源。

3. Add to your quotations all relevant bibliographical information. This material will appear later in your list of works cited, but it is advantageous to have it before you so that you can easily identify the source when you do your final draft.

 

4. 此时获取所有标题、日期和技术信息。在标题旁边的括号中注明电影的发行日期。如果您打算同时使用外文标题和英文标题，请务必仔细检查两者。在文本中使用作者姓名时，请提供文章、书籍或评论中出现的全名。在后续引用该作者时，仅使用姓氏（在大多数情况下没有必要使用教授或女士等头衔）。

4. Get all titles, dates, and technical information right at this point. Include the date the film was released in parentheses next to the title. If you intend to use both the foreign-language title and the English title, be sure to double-check both. When using an author’s name in your text, give the full name as it appears in the article, book, or review. In subsequent references to this author, use just the last name (it is unnecessary in most cases to use a title like Professor or Ms).

 

5. 这个早期草稿也可能是写出您所参考的镜头或序列的具体描述的最佳位置。当您的观点需要使用其他电影作为示例时，请考虑并插入这些标题。

5. This early draft may also be the best place to write out concrete descriptions of the shots or sequences to which you refer. When your points require the use of other films as examples, consider and insert those titles.

 

6. 当你修改这个草稿时，用引言介绍你的研究和引文，以便你从中获得最大的收益。将你所有的研究都塞进一个部分，或者用“A 说”或“B 说”（或者更糟糕的是，根本没有介绍性短语）来介绍每个引文，表明你没有仔细考虑如何最好地利用你的研究。一个好的修辞策略是让读者知道你为什么使用这些材料，比如“在这篇对电影的敏锐评论中……”或“这篇评论总结了对电影的典型但肤浅的反应……”有时简短的评论或短语可以直接融入你的散文中并简单地注释：

6. When you revise this draft, introduce your research and quotations with a lead-in so that you get the most from them. Cramming all your research into one section or introducing each quotation with “A says” or “B says” (or, worse yet, no introductory phrase at all) suggests that you have not considered carefully how best to use your research. A good rhetorical strategy is to let the reader know why you are using the material by remarking, “In this perceptive review of the film...” or “A typical but superficial response to the movie is summed up in this comment...” Sometimes short remarks or phrases can be integrated directly into your prose and simply annotated:

 

正如一位作家所说，结尾是“对观众的一种令人困惑的攻击”（King 121）。

The closing is, as one writer put it, “a confusing assault on the viewer” (King 121).

 

如果您要对比解释，请以使用和引入引文或释义的方式明确说明。你可能会引用这样的引文：“考虑一下吴在这里使用闪回的两种相反的观点。” 最后，你的读者不仅应该感觉到他们已经阅读了一个具体且结构良好的论点，而且还应该感觉到它是基于对电影的合理判断、围绕电影的事​​实以及其他知识渊博的观众的看法。

If you are contrasting interpretations, make that clear in the way you use and introduce the quotations or paraphrases. You might lead into the quotations thus: “Consider two opposing views of Woo’s use of flashbacks here.” In the end, your readers should feel not only that they have read a specific and well-formulated argument, but also that it is based on sound judgments about the film, the facts surrounding the film, and the perceptions of other knowledgeable viewers.

 

7. 如果你最后的草稿很容易阅读，那么在电脑屏幕上修改就会容易得多。

7. If your last draft is easy to read, it will be much easier to revise on the computer screen.

 

8. 打印出论文的最终草稿后，检查所有参考文献信息的标题、日期和页码。确保您已将所有在作品引用部分（第 165-168 页）中使用的作品纳入其中，并且如果您选择这样做，则将您查阅（但也许没有使用）的所有作品纳入作品查阅部分（第 165 页）。

8. After you have printed out a final draft of the essay, check the titles, dates, and page numbers of all your bibliographical information. Be sure you have included all the works used in the works-cited section (pp. 165–168) and, if you choose to, all the works you consulted (but, perhaps, did not use) in a works-consulted section (p. 165).

 

9. 请务必在计算机上保存和备份您的工作，并在提交论文之前制作一份额外的副本，以防原件丢失或被您或您的导师放错地方。

9. Be certain to save and back up your work on your computer and make an extra copy of it before submitting the paper in case the original is lost or misplaced by you or your instructor.

 

论文样本

SAMPLE ESSAYS

 

以下是同一篇文章的两个版本：一个依赖于聪明的作家对电影的仔细思考；另一个依赖于聪明的作家对电影的仔细思考。另一个通过适量的研究来发展这些知识。两个版本都很有能力，但第二个版本具有修辞力量和权威，将其与第一个区分开来。还要注意研究不仅支持最初的想法，而且还不仅仅支持最初的想法。它可以帮助作者进一步发展这些想法，甚至改变他们的方向。

The following are two versions of the same essay: One relies on an intelligent writer’s careful reflection on the movie; the other develops that knowledge through a moderate amount of research. Both versions are competent, but the second carries a rhetorical force and authority that distinguish it from the first. Notice also how research does more than just support the original ideas; it helps the writer to develop those ideas further and even to change their direction.

佩恩的《邦妮与克莱德》中的暴力画面

Images of Violence in Penn’s Bonnie and Clyde

 

阿瑟·佩恩的《邦妮与克莱德》（1967）基本上是一部黑帮电影，歌颂了邦妮·帕克和克莱德·巴罗这两个三十年代在逃的年轻罪犯的生活。从主题上看，这部电影最引人注目的特点之一是这些小流氓如何在一个似乎在各方面崩溃的社会中成为有传奇色彩的英雄。从风格上来说，这部电影也很出色。通过一系列令人惊叹的镜头，最终以影片结尾时两人的怪诞杀戮达到高潮，这部电影似乎不断地引起人们对自身作为一部关于图像制作的电影的关注。《邦妮与克莱德》将这些主题和风格融入扣人心弦的悬疑故事中，是一部不寻常且令人费解的电影，讲述了两个人迫切需要逃离社会日常苦难和​​逃避所必需的暴力之间的奇异关系。

Arthur Penn’s Bonnie and Clyde (1967) is basically a gangster movie which glorifies the lives of Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow, two young criminals on the run in the thirties. Thematically, one of the most striking features of the film is how these small-time hoodlums become larger-than-life heroes in a society that seems to be crumbling in every way. Stylistically, the film is also remarkable. Through a number of stunning shots, which culminate in the grotesque killing of the pair at the conclusion of the film, the movie seems constantly to call attention to itself as a movie about image making. Integrating these themes and style in a gripping and suspenseful story, Bonnie and Clyde is an unusual and perplexing movie about the bizarre relationship between two people’s desperate need to escape the daily miseries of their society and the violence that is necessary for that escape.

 

这部黑帮电影的一个不寻常的变化是，英雄（或反英雄）也是受害者，是小丑般的流浪者，他们卷入犯罪生活主要是因为他们需要某种身份（图6.02）。这些公敌似乎从未表现出任何真正的恶意或与詹姆斯·卡格尼类型的黑帮相关的职业信心。通过精心构图和虚化的镜头，他们生活的土地似乎是一片荒原，他们遇到的人大多是悲伤和贫穷的。邦妮加入克莱德的第一次抢劫企图，因为她感到无聊、孤独，想寻找一些刺激，在后来的场景中，克莱德似乎感到震惊和困惑，因为他的一个受害者实际上应该通过试图杀死克莱德来保护自己。

One of the unusual variations in this gangster film is that the heroes (or antiheroes) are also victims, clownish drifters who become involved in a life of crime mainly because they need an identity of one sort or another (Figure 6.02). These public enemies never seem to demonstrate any of the real malice or the professional confidence that is associated with a gangster of the James Cagney variety. Through the work of carefully framed and emptied shots, the land they live in seems a wasteland, the people they encounter mostly sad and poor. Bonnie joins Clyde in her first robbery attempt because she is bored, lonely, and looking for some excitement, and in a later scene, Clyde seems shocked and confused that one of his victims should actually defend himself by trying to kill Clyde.

 

图6.02 《邦妮与克莱德》（1967）中的亡命之徒：黑帮还是政客？

Figure 6.02 The desperadoes of Bonnie and Clyde (1967): gangsters, or politicians?

 

更重要的是，随着电影的进展，这两个歹徒的动机似乎更多的是希望在报纸上看到他们的名字和照片，而不是希望积累大量金钱（这在帮派中很少讨论）。当克莱德的哥哥巴克来拜访时，邦妮和克莱德被拍成了黑帮的戏剧姿势，对他们来说，这种夸张的自己形象——主要是在报纸和公众的想象中——让他们能够在饱受抑郁症蹂躏的社会中拥有真正的身份。克莱德总结了他们暴力犯罪生活的真正原因，并大喊“每个人都会知道我们！”，说服邦妮加入他的行列。

More important, as the film progresses, these two gangsters seem motivated more by the wish to see their names and pictures in the paper than by a wish to accumulate large amounts of money (which is rarely discussed by the gang). When Clyde’s brother, Buck, comes to visit, Bonnie and Clyde have their pictures taken in the theatrical pose of gangsters, and for them, this kind of exaggerated image of themselves—mostly in the paper and the public’s imagination—is what allows them to have a real identity in their depression-ravaged society. Summing up their true reason for their violent life of crime, Clyde convinces Bonnie to join him by exclaiming, “Everybody’d know about us!”

 

从这个意义上说，这两个罪犯不仅是他们社会的受害者（这是陈词滥调），而且是煽情主义的受害者。他们需要并且媒体迎合。（这在今天看来比三十年代更真实。）在某种程度上，他们对自己光鲜亮丽的形象的需要决定了他们的命运，因为正是他们用报纸照片羞辱了德克萨斯游骑兵队，激励了他追捕他们。最终，简而言之，他们陷入了对光辉自我形象的渴望的逻辑中，就像在电影的结尾处一样，克莱德既悲惨又滑稽地无法想象一种不同的生活，而只是不同的生活。抢劫银行的策略。

In this sense, these two criminals are not just victims of their society (an old cliché) but victims of the sensationalism which they need and which the press panders to. (This seems more true today than it possibly could have in the thirties.) In a way, their need for those glossy images of themselves is what seals their fate, since it is their humiliation of the Texas Ranger with a newspaper photo that motivates him to hunt them down. Ultimately, to put this succinctly, they are trapped in the logic of their desire for glorious self-images, just as toward the end of the film, Clyde is—tragically and comically—unable to envision a different kind of life, but only different tactics for robbing banks.

 

因此，电影的耸人听闻的高潮和结局是完全恰当的。两位“英雄”的死亡发生在他们读了邦妮对他们的冒险的诗意描述，然后第一次做爱的场景，这是对电影逻辑的概括性陈述。当克莱德读到这首民谣时，他说：“你讲述了我们的故事……你让我们成为了重要人物。” 简而言之，他们已经找到了他们一直在寻找的身份和公众形象，现在他们能够完善他们的爱情了。此外，接下来的慢动作、多角度的死亡可以被视为他们新发现的身份的延伸。受困于煽情主义和公众形象的逻辑，他们最终发现自己只能死在煽情的电影形象中。

The sensational climax and conclusion of the movie are consequently entirely appropriate. That the death of the two “heroes” follows a scene in which they read Bonnie’s poetic description of their adventures and then make love for the first time is a summary statement of the movie’s logic. When Clyde reads the ballad, he says, “You’ve told our story.... You’ve made us somebody.” They have found, in short, the identities and public images they have been searching for, and they are now able to consummate their love. The slow-motion, multiangled death that follows can be seen, moreover, as an extension of their newfound identities. Trapped in the logic of sensationalism and public images, they, in the end, find themselves only in the sensational movie images in which they die.

 

凯瑟琳·史密斯

Katherine Smith

 

佩恩的《邦妮与克莱德》中的暴力画面

Images of Violence in Penn’s Bonnie and Clyde

 

尽管《邦妮与克莱德》（1967）仍然保留了大部分原有的力量，但当代观众可能很难充分欣赏这部极其成功的电影的影响。大卫·库克在他的《叙事电影史》中总结了这部动荡的电影所受到的热烈欢迎：

Although Bonnie and Clyde (1967) still retains much of its original power, it may be difficult for contemporary audiences to appreciate fully the impact of this extremely successful movie. In his History of Narrative Film, David Cook summarizes the tumultuous reception of this tumultuous movie:

 

新的美国电影和新的美国电影观众以1967 年，阿瑟·佩恩 (Arthur Penn) 的《邦妮与克莱德》(Bonnie and Clyde)上映。这部电影在八月份上映时受到了影评人的普遍攻击，到了十一月份却成为了年度最受欢迎的电影。随后，它获得了十项奥斯卡金像奖提名，并赢得两项……，赢得纽约影评人奖最佳剧本奖……并被许多最初批评它的影评人评为 1967 年最佳影片。最成功的也许是，《邦妮与克莱德》是唯一一部迫使《时代》杂志公开撤回批评意见的电影……事实上，《邦妮与克莱德》的巨大成功导致许多老电影撤回评论。评论家们在第一次观看时将其误认为是一部传统的血腥黑帮电影。(626)

A new American cinema and a new American film audience announced themselves emphatically with the release in 1967 of Arthur Penn’s Bonnie and Clyde. This film, which was universally attacked by the critics when it opened in August, had by November become the most popular film of the year. It would subsequently receive ten Academy Awards nominations and win two..., win the New York Film Critics’ Award for Best Script...and be named the Best Film of 1967 by many of the critics who had originally panned it. Most triumphant of all, perhaps, Bonnie and Clyde is the only film ever to have forced the public retraction of a critical opinion by Time magazine.... Indeed, the phenomenal success of Bonnie and Clyde caused many retractions on the part of veteran film critics who, on first viewing, had mistaken it for a conventional bloody, gangster film. (626)

 

当然，不可否认的是，这部电影基本上是 1930 年代的血腥后裔，根据 1934 年联邦调查局的一份报告，邦妮和克莱德煽动了“当时美国所见过的最丰富多彩、最壮观的追捕行动之一”。 (1). 通过其纪实风格和片尾字幕中使用的旧照片，佩恩的电影似乎将自己呈现为三十年代的肖像。但我相信，对这部电影最初的混乱反应表明，还有更多的事情发生：佩恩，通过他据称从法国新浪潮中学到的自我意识风格，1正在对现代暴力图像提供复杂的评论以及对美国人如何逃避这些形象的令人不安的批评，尤其是在六十年代。

There is, of course, no denying that the movie is basically a bloody descendant of the 1930s when, according to a 1934 FBI report, Bonnie and Clyde instigated “one of the most colorful and spectacular manhunts the Nation had seen up to that time” (1). Through its documentary style and the old photos used during the credit sequence, Penn’s film seems to present itself as a portrait of the thirties. But the confused initial response to the movie indicates, I believe, that there is something more going on: that Penn, through the self-conscious style he supposedly learned from the French New Wave,1 is offering a complicated commentary on modern images of violence in America and a disturbing critique of how Americans have escaped into those images, especially during the sixties.

 

有多种迹象表明，这不仅仅是一部黑帮电影，而且故事背景也超越了 20 世纪 30 年代。最值得注意的是，在这部黑帮电影中，英雄（或反英雄）似乎也是受害者，是小丑般的流浪者，他们卷入犯罪生活主要是因为他们需要某种身份。这些公敌似乎从未表现出任何真正的恶意或与詹姆斯·卡格尼类型的黑帮相关的职业信心；同样，他们生活的世界也缺乏黑帮世界的所有魅力。通过精心构图和空镜头的工作，他们开车经过的土地似乎是一片荒地，他们遇到的人大多是悲伤和贫穷的。邦妮加入克莱德的第一次抢劫企图，因为她感到无聊、孤独，想寻找一些刺激，在后来的场景中，克莱德似乎感到震惊和困惑，因为他的一个受害者实际上应该通过试图杀死克莱德来保护自己。

There are several signs that this is more than a gangster film and about more than the 1930s. Most notably, in this gangster film, the heroes (or antiheroes) also seem to be victims, clownish drifters who become involved in a life of crime mainly because they need an identity of one sort or another. These public enemies never seem to demonstrate any of the real malice or the professional confidence associated with the James Cagney variety of gangster; likewise, the world they live in lacks all the glamour of a gangster’s world. Through the work of carefully framed and emptied shots, the land they drive through seems a wasteland, the people they encounter mostly sad and poor. Bonnie joins Clyde in her first robbery attempt because she is bored, lonely, and looking for some excitement, and in a later scene, Clyde seems shocked and confused that one of his victims should actually defend himself by trying to kill Clyde.

 

更重要的是，随着电影的进展，这两个歹徒的动机似乎更多的是希望在报纸上看到他们的名字和照片，而不是希望积累大量金钱（这在帮派中很少讨论）。当克莱德的兄弟巴克来拜访时，邦妮和克莱德被拍成了黑帮的戏剧姿势，对他们来说，这些夸张的自己形象——大多出现在报纸和公众的想象中——让他们能够远离饱受抑郁症蹂躏的社会，拥有真正的身份。克莱德总结了他们暴力犯罪生活的真正原因，并大喊“每个人都会知道我们！”，说服邦妮加入他的行列。这两个罪犯不仅是他们社会的受害者（这是陈词滥调），而且是他们所需要的和媒体迎合的轰动效应的受害者。

More important, as the film progresses, these two gangsters seem motivated more by the wish to see their names and pictures in the paper than by a wish to accumulate large amounts of money (which is rarely discussed by the gang). When Clyde’s brother, Buck, comes to visit, Bonnie and Clyde have their pictures taken in the theatrical poses of gangsters, and for them, these kinds of exaggerated images of themselves—mostly found in the papers and the public’s imagination—are what allows them to have a real identity apart from their depression-ravaged society. Summing up their true reason for their violent life of crime, Clyde convinces Bonnie to join him by exclaiming, “Everybody’d know about us!” These two criminals are not just victims of their society (an old cliché) but victims of the sensationalism which they need and which the press panders to.

 

在我看来，暴力和宣传之间的这种联系使《邦妮和克莱德》既具有六十年代末的风格，又具有三十年代的风格。六十年代末，当越南的暴力事件出现在每个人的电视屏幕上时，媒体都在迎合和报道制造前所未有的耸人听闻的暴力。2正如宝琳·凯尔敏锐地观察到的那样，尽管“越南战争在银幕上几乎没有提及，但……你可以在《邦妮与克莱德》中感受到它”（225）。我相信，观众最能具体地看到和感受到战争的地方不仅在于电影中大量的暴力画面，更重要的是，电影将其暴力与媒体报道的煽情行为逻辑地联系起来。在某种程度上，邦妮和克莱德对自己光鲜亮丽的形象的需求是他们的动力，也决定了他们的命运，因为正是他们用报纸照片羞辱了德克萨斯游骑兵，导致他无情地追捕他们。他们陷入了对光荣自我形象的渴望的暴力逻辑中——就像电影接近尾声时，克莱德（悲剧性和滑稽地）无法想象一种不同的生活，而只能想象不同的抢劫银行策略。

This connection between violence and publicity seems to me to make Bonnie and Clyde as much about the late sixties as about the thirties. In the late sixties, when the violence of Vietnam was on everyone’s television screen, the media were pandering to and creating sensational violence as never before.2 As Pauline Kael has perceptively observed, although the “Vietnam war has barely been mentioned on the screen,...you can feel it in Bonnie and Clyde” (225). Where an audience can most specifically see and feel that war is, I believe, not only in the large amounts of graphic violence in the film but, more significantly, in the way the movie logically links its violence to the sensationalism of the media coverage. In a way, Bonnie and Clyde’s need for glossy images of themselves is what motivates them and what seals their fate, since it is their humiliation of the Texas Ranger with a newspaper photo that results in his relentlessly hunting them down. They are trapped in the violent logic of their desire for glorious self-images—just as toward the end of the movie, Clyde is (tragically and comically) unable to envision a different kind of life but only different tactics for robbing banks.

 

简而言之，邦妮和克莱德既不是简单地从犯罪中幸存下来的三十多岁的黑帮，也不是寻找身份的六十年代的叛逆者。他们是光荣而暴力的轰动效应的盲目参与者，同样的轰动效应，公共媒体在饱受战争蹂躏的六十年代创造了混乱的国家认同。

Bonnie and Clyde, in short, are neither simply thirties gangsters surviving through crime nor sixties rebels searching for identities. They are mindless participants in a glorious and violent sensationalism, the same sensationalism with which the public media created a confused national identity during the war-torn sixties.

 

因此，耸人听闻的高潮和结局完全适合一部关于在暴力社会中寻找身份的电影。两位“英雄”的死亡发生在他们在报纸上读到邦妮对他们的冒险的诗意描述，然后第一次做爱的场景，这是对电影逻辑的概括性陈述。当克莱德读到这首民谣时，他说：“你讲述了我们的故事……你让我们成为了重要人物。” 简而言之，他们已经找到了他们一直在寻找的身份和公众形象，现在他们能够完善他们的爱情了。可以看到随后的慢动作、多角度的死亡，此外，作为新发现的身份的延伸。他们陷入暴力煽情和公众形象的逻辑之中，很自然地发现自己只能死在暴力和煽情的电影形象中。

The sensational climax and conclusion are consequently entirely appropriate in a film about the search for identity in a violent society. That the death of the two “heroes” follows scenes in which they read Bonnie’s poetic description of their adventure in the newspaper and then make love for the first time is a summary statement of the film’s logic. When Clyde reads the ballad, he says, “You’ve told our story.... You’ve made us somebody.” They have found, in short, the identities and public images they have been searching for, and they are now able to consummate their love. The slow-motion, multiangled death that follows can be seen, moreover, as an extension of that newfound identity. Trapped in the logic of violent sensationalism and public images, they aptly find themselves only in the violent and sensational movie images in which they die.

 

然而，作为六十年代的间接形象，《邦妮和克莱德》可能并不像看起来那样是绝望的陈述。如果邦妮和克莱德被困住了，佩恩的电影可能会通过对 1967 年观众的自我意识和生动的攻击来解救他们。就像法国新浪潮导演一样，佩恩可能一直试图让他的观众更积极地思考他们所经历的暴力形象。从这个意义上说，对邦妮和克莱德的混乱和矛盾的反应可能表明它达到了目的。

As an indirect image of the sixties, Bonnie and Clyde may not be, however, as much a statement of despair as it seems. If Bonnie and Clyde are trapped, Penn’s movie may have worked to untrap its 1967 audience through its self-conscious and graphic assault on them. Like the French New Wave directors, Penn may have been attempting to make his audience consider more actively the violent images through which they lived. In that sense, the confused and contradictory response to Bonnie and Clyde may be an indication that it achieved its aim.

 

参考文献

Works Cited

 

库克、大卫. 叙事电影史。纽约：诺顿，1981。

Cook, David. A History of Narrative Film. New York: Norton, 1981.

 

联邦调查局信息自由法电子 阅览室。2000 年 3 月 3 日http://foia.fbi.gov/bonclyd.html。

Federal Bureau of Investigation Freedom of Information Act Electronic Reading Room. 3 March 2000 http://foia.fbi.gov/bonclyd.html.

 

凯尔、波琳. 缫丝。纽约：华纳图书，1972 年。

Kael, Pauline. Reeling. New York: Warner Books, 1972.

 

练习

Exercises

  1. 找到特定电影主题的三种不同的研究来源：一种来自学术期刊，一种来自书籍，一种来自互联网。对每个人写一个段落，评估他们的个人优势和劣势。
  2. Locate three different kinds of research sources for a specific film topic: one from a scholarly journal, one from a book, and one from the Internet. Write a paragraph on each, evaluating their individual strengths and weaknesses.
  3. 从涉及特定电影的两个不同研究来源中选择两个段落。在每段文章上写一个段落，简洁地总结该段落的要点，并详细说明您同意或不同意该段落的立场的原因。
  4. Select two passages from two different research sources dealing with a specific film. Write a paragraph on each passage succinctly summarizing the point of the passage and detailing why you agree or disagree with the position of that passage.

7

稿件表格

7

MANUSCRIPT FORM

 

手稿副本

MANUSCRIPT COPY

 

尽管每位教师对提交论文的最终形式都有个人的期望和要求，但所有作者在将论文提交为最终形式时都遵循一般准则：

Although every instructor has individual expectations and requirements about the final form in which an essay should be submitted, all writers follow general guidelines when putting an essay into its final form:

1. 打印一份干净的论文。印刷干净的手稿看起来更专业，通常更容易阅读。专业的外表可以让你在读者中占据优势，他们从一开始就会认为你的作品是你认真对待的。一些作家发现论文的硬拷贝可以让他们从新的角度阅读和修改他们的作品。如果您有时间和文字处理技能，那么在进行最终修改之前修改打印的草稿是一个真正的优势。

1. Print out a clean copy of your paper. A cleanly printed manuscript simply looks more professional and is usually easier to read. A professional appearance gives you an edge with your reader, who will see your work from the beginning as something you took seriously. Some writers find that a hard copy of the paper allows them to read and revise their work from a new perspective. When you have the time and the word-processing skills, it is a real advantage to revise a printed draft before making your final revisions.

2. 使用干净的 8.5 x 11 英寸纸张，在一侧打印，打印清晰、易于阅读。

2. Use clean 8.5-by-11-inch paper, printed on one side, with sharp, easily readable print.

3. 大多数教师更喜欢您将您的姓名、日期，也许还有课程编号放在第一页右上角的三行中。通常不需要单独的标题页。

3. Most instructors prefer that you put your name, date, and perhaps the course number on three lines in the right-hand corner of the first page. Separate title pages are normally unnecessary.

4. 不必对第一页进行编号，但一定要对后续所有页面进行编号。通常，页码出现在每页顶部的中间或右上角。页面底部居中的数字也是可以接受的。

4. It is not necessary to number the first page, but be certain to number all the following pages. Usually, page numbers appear at the top of each page in the middle or the right-hand corner. Numbers centered at the bottom of the page are also acceptable.

5. 在每页上留出均匀且足够的边距：页面两侧、顶部和底部各留出一英寸或一英寸半。认为较大的页边空白会以某种方式掩盖短篇论文的想法是愚蠢的。

5. Leave uniform and adequate margins on each page: an inch or an inch and a half on both sides and at the top and the bottom of the page. It is silly to think that larger margins will somehow disguise a short paper.

6. 除长引号外，所有副本均采用双倍行距，长引号是缩进且单倍行距的。（现代语言协会 [MLA] 指南说，即使是长的、缩进的段落也要加倍行距，但这种做法主要用于提交给期刊的专业论文。）

6. Double-space all the copy, except for long quotes, which are indented and single-spaced. (The Modern Language Association [MLA] guide says to double-space even the long, indented passages, but this practice is used mainly for professional essays being submitted to journals.)

7. 将标题居中距第一页顶部两英寸（十二行）。在标题下方一英寸处开始你的文章。标题中每个单词的首字母大写，介词、冠词和连词除外。

7. Center your title two inches (twelve lines) from the top of the first page. Begin your essay one inch below the title. Capitalize the first letter of each word in your title, except prepositions, articles, and conjunctions.

仅在标题中出现的电影标题下划线或斜体。请勿在标题的任何其他部分加下划线或使用引号，除非该部分来自其他来源并需要这些标点符号。因此，标准标题将如下所示：

Underline or italicize only the titles of films that appear in your title. Do not underline or use quotation marks around any other part of your title, unless that part comes from another source and requires these punctuation marks. Thus a standard title would appear like this:

康拉德、科波拉和现代启示录

Conrad, Coppola, and Apocalypse Now

 

当您在标题中使用其他来源的引用时，引用的材料会出现在引号中：

When you use a quotation from another source within your title, the quoted material appears in quotation marks:

黑暗之心的版本：

Versions of a Heart of Darkness:

 

《现代启示录》的“恐怖，恐怖”

“The Horror, the Horror” of Apocalypse Now

 

当标题无法轻松地放在一行中时，第二行比将标题挤在页面宽度内更好。第二行也应该居中。

When a title does not fit easily on one line, a second line is preferable to crowding a title within the width of a page. The second line should also be centered.

8. 每个新段落从左边距缩进五个空格。

8. Indent each new paragraph five spaces from the left margin.

9. 大多数老师并不希望你的论文附有剧照，而且包含一张华丽的剧照也不是一个特别好的主意，它除了装饰你的论文之外没有更大的作用。然而，当一篇文章的重点是单个镜头或一系列镜头时，在论文末尾的附录中复制一个静态图片或一系列静态图片可能会有所帮助。如果您可以获得相关的剧照（或多张剧照），请确保对其进行复制并清晰标记，在文本中讨论它时确定其在电影中的位置，并在此时明确提及复制品：

9. Most instructors do not expect stills to accompany your essay, nor is it an especially good idea to include a showy still that serves no greater purpose than to dress up your paper. When an essay is focused on a single shot or a series of shots, however, it may be helpful to reproduce a still or a series of stills in an appendix at the end of your paper. If you can obtain a pertinent still (or stills), be sure that it is reproduced and labeled clearly, that you identify its place in the film when you discuss it in your text, and that you refer explicitly to the reproduction at that point:

在《现代启示录》中，疯狂的政治戏剧在丛林深处的花花公子兔子秀中具体化（见附录 1）。

In Apocalypse Now, the insane theatrics of politics crystallize in the Playboy Bunny Show deep in the jungle (see Appendix 1).

 

10. 务必备份最终草稿的副本或保留论文的副本，以防原件丢失或放错地方。

10. Always back up a copy of your final draft or make a copy of your essay to keep in case your original is lost or misplaced.

11. 将纸张钉在左上角。

11. Staple your paper in the upper-left-hand corner.

最后一刻的修正

LAST-MINUTE CORRECTIONS

 

作者很容易在最后一刻进行修改或更正。当你的论文最终印刷出来后，修改应该保持在最低限度，因为太多的铅笔修改会破坏干净打字稿的预期效果。然而，当您校对最终副本时，您可能会发现小错误、拼写错误和印刷错误，并且可以通过使用校对符号和标记来巧妙地纠正这些错误。更好的是：打印出新更正的副本。

Writers are prone to making last-minute revisions or corrections. After your paper is in its final printed form, corrections should be kept to a minimum, because too many penciled-in changes will destroy the desired effect of a cleanly typed manuscript. As you proofread your final copy, however, you might discover small errors, misspellings, and typographical mistakes, and you can correct these neatly by using proofreading symbols and markings. Better yet: print out a newly corrected copy.

要添加单词或短语，请在适当的空格中使用插入符号：

To add a word or a phrase, use a caret in the appropriate space:

 

字母或单词的转置是这样完成的：

Transpositions of letters or words are done in this way:

 

要分隔错误地连在一起的单词，请插入竖线；用连接需要连接的字母的曲线来闭合不必要的间隙：

To separate words that are mistakenly run together, insert a vertical line; close unnecessary gaps with a curved line connecting the letters that need to be joined:

 

最终校对可能会发现应该分成两段的段落。使用段落符号指示新段落的开始位置：

A final proofreading may reveal a paragraph that should be broken into two paragraphs. Use the paragraph symbol to indicate where a new paragraph should start:

 

当一两个单词不正确时，您只需划掉错误的单词或字母并在其上方打印必要的更正即可轻松更改它们：

When one or two words are incorrect, you can easily change them by simply crossing out the wrong words or letters and printing the necessary corrections above them:

 

报价

QUOTATIONS

 

在撰写有关电影的文章时，您将不得不处理两种引用：

In writing about film, you will have to deal with two kinds of quotations:

1. 引用电影本身的对话或评论时，一般不需要脚注，所引用的文字可以直接融入到正文中。

1. In quoting dialogue or commentary from the film itself, normally no footnotes are necessary, and the words quoted can be integrated directly into your text.

2. 在引用论文、书籍或对参与制作的个人的采访时，您需要某种脚注和文档。如果这些引文是短文，它们也可以直接插入到你的散文中：

2. In quoting from essays, books, or interviews with individuals involved in the production, you need some kind of footnote and documentation. If these quotations are short passages, they, too, can be inserted directly into your prose:

一位著名评论家将这部电影描述为“对后现代空虚的研究”。

One prominent critic has described this film as “a study in postmodern emptiness.”

 

论文的长短与引用的使用没有什么关系，但是当使用引用时，它们应该被正确地标点并明智地分布在整个文章中（永远不要让你的文章成为一串引用）。以下是一些一般准则：

Whether the paper is short or long has little to do with the use of quotations, but when quotations are used, they should be punctuated properly and spread judiciously throughout the essay (never make your essay a string of quotations). The following are some general guidelines:

1. 无论你引用什么，都要准确，并在校对时检查引用的段落。在大多数情况下，引文的拼写、大小写和标点符号应与原文完全一致。当您在引文中添加材料时，请将这些词放在括号中。当您在某个单词或短语下划线以强调它时，请注意它是在引用后的括号中强调的：

1. Whatever you are quoting, be accurate and check the quoted passages when you proofread. In most cases, quotations should correspond exactly to the original in spelling, capitalization, and punctuation. When you add material within the quotation, put those words in brackets. When you underline a word or phrase to emphasize it, note that it is your emphasis in parentheses after the quotation:

许多因素使三十年代的美国制片厂与众不同，但是，用一位历史学家的话说，“[三十年代]美国制片厂的等级制度在某些关键方面是由他们所针对的观众阶层决定的”（Venuti 122，我的重点）。

Many factors distinguished the American studios of the thirties, but, in the words of one historian, “The hierarchy of American studios [in the thirties] was in some crucial ways determined by the class of audience they targeted” (Venuti 122, my emphasis).

 

如果您需要或希望省略引用段落中不必要的单词，请用三个间隔的句点（称为省略号）表示省略：

If you need or wish to omit unnecessary words within a quoted passage, signal the omission with three spaced periods, called ellipsis points:

用一位历史学家的话来说，“美国电影公司的等级制度……是由他们的目标观众阶层决定的”（Venuti 122）。

In the words of one historian, “The hierarchy of American studios was... determined by the class of audience they targeted” (Venuti 122).

 

句子的开头或结尾不需要省略号。如果省略号在引用段落的中间结束一个句子，请在该句子末尾添加一个句号，然后在省略号中添加三个句号。

Ellipsis points are not needed at the very beginning or end of a sentence. If the ellipsis ends a sentence in the middle of a quoted passage, include a period at the end of that sentence, then three periods for the ellipsis.

2. 不要使用引用的段落来表达你的观点或占用大量空间。用它们来支持你的观点。

2. Do not use quoted passages to make your points for you or to take up large blocks of space. Use them to support your points.

3. 如果您要引用电影中的长段对话或两个角色之间的对话，则该引用通常是单倍行距并缩进，而不是在文本中放入引号：

3. If you are quoting a long piece of dialogue from a movie or an exchange between two characters, this quotation is usually single-spaced and indented rather than put in quotation marks in your text:

B ERNARD：首先，并非所有女性。其次你让我害怕。有时你会严厉地看着我，甚至带着某种敌意。

BERNARD: First of all, not all women. And secondly you frighten me. Sometimes you looked at me severely, and even with a certain hostility.

 

玛丽昂：带着一定的敌意？真的吗？

MARION: With a certain hostility? Really?

 

超过四行打字稿或印刷品的段落也应缩进，不带引号。当您缩进引用对话或长段落时，请在引用前后使用三倍行距，以及在段落中使用单倍行距或双倍行距，具体取决于教师的偏好。大多数专业出版物要求这些段落像手稿的其他部分一样采用双倍行距，但对于大多数学生研究论文来说，单倍行距的段落看起来更好。

Passages longer than four lines of typescript or print should also be indented without quotation marks. When you indent to quote dialogue or long passages, triple-space before and after the quote, and either single-space or double-space the passage, depending on the preference of your instructor. Most professional publications ask that these passages be double-spaced like the rest of the manuscript, but for most student research papers, a single-spaced passage looks better.

4. 介绍您的报价；永远不要以未宣布的引语结束一个句子并开始下一个句子。最常见的是，这意味着用诸如以下的短语来确认文章的说话者或来源：

4. Introduce your quotations; never end one sentence and begin the next sentence with an unannounced quotation. Most commonly, this means acknowledging the speaker or source of the passage with a phrase such as

安德烈·巴赞评论：...

André Bazin comments:...

 

或者

or

正如克拉考尔在《电影理论》中所说的那样， ......

As Kracauer has argued in Theory of Film,...

 

对于对你的论点特别重要的引文，或者可能有点难以与你的观点联系起来的引文，附近的短语或句子可以重新表述中心点，这样就不会错过：

For quotations that are especially important to your argument or that may be a bit difficult to relate to your point, a nearby phrase or sentence can rephrase the central point so that it is not missed:

关于电影图像与物理现实关系的争论在安德烈·巴赞的作品中成为一个明确的社会和形而上学问题。正如他所说，...

The debate about the relation of the film image and physical reality becomes an explicitly social and metaphysical issue in the work of André Bazin. As he says,...

 

5. 将引文整合到自己的句子中时，尽可能简洁，并调整它们以适应散文的语法和句法。有时，您可能希望使用括号将您自己的语言插入到引文中间（如第 158 页列表中的第 1 项）。

5. When integrating quotations into your own sentences, make them as succinct as possible and adjust them to fit the grammar and syntax of your prose. At times, you may wish to use brackets to insert your own language into the middle of a quotation (as in item 1 in the list on pp. 158).

6. 在美国用法中，句点和逗号放在引号内；冒号和分号放在外面。当感叹号、问号和破折号作为原始段落的一部分出现时，它们位于引号内；当它们作为句子的一部分时，则位于引号外。

6. In American usage, periods and commas are placed inside the quotation marks; colons and semicolons are placed outside. Exclamation points, question marks, and dashes are placed inside the quotation marks when they appear as part of the original passage and outside when they are part of your sentence.

7. 当您使用的引用内有引用时，内引用使用单引号：

7. When there is a quotation within the quote you are using, use single quotation marks for the inner quotation:

“克拉考尔作品中最具挑衅性和问题性的陈述是‘物理现实的救赎’。”

“The most provocative and problematic statement in Kracauer’s work is ‘the redemption of physical reality.’”

 

如果此嵌入引用是缩进段落的一部分，则它将显示双引号，因为缩进句子块未包含在引号内。

If this embedded quotation were part of an indented passage, it would appear with double quotation marks because the block of indented sentences is not enclosed within quotation marks.

8.双引号用于引出较短作品的标题，例如散文、文章、短诗和歌曲。在电影、书籍、长诗、专辑、戏剧和绘画的标题下划线或斜体。无论电影是短还是长，其标题都是斜体。剧本的标题是斜体的。电视剧的标题是斜体的；这些系列的剧集用引号引起来。

8. Double quotation marks are used to set off the titles of shorter works, such as essays, articles, short poems, and songs. Underline or italicize titles of movies, books, long poems, albums, plays, and paintings. Whether a movie is short or long, its title is italicized. The title of a screenplay is italicized. The titles of television series are italicized; episodes of those series are in quotation marks.

确认来源

ACKNOWLEDGING SOURCES

 

写论文的时候，一定要清楚什么是自己的想法，什么是借鉴别人的想法。承认并注意到其他观点和评论永远不会降低论文的质量或强度；相反，这些致谢通过将你的想法置于其他工作的背景中来强化和合法化你的想法。当读者出于某种原因认为你没有明确区分自己的看法和想法与他人的看法和想法时，就会出现问题。在这些情况下，读者和作者之间的信任被打破，至少，读者会开始怀疑作者是否真正理解他或她在说什么。涉嫌抄袭将破坏论文中的所有辛勤工作。因此，在研究和写作时，必须明确区分直接取自其他来源的句子和单词、他人单词的释义或摘要以及从其他来源挪用的一般思想。

When writing an essay, you must maintain a clear sense of what is your own thinking and what is borrowed from others.
